speaker: Vigarde
text: General Glen of the Grado Imperial Army, also known as the Sunstone...

speaker: Glen
text: Yes...

speaker: Vigarde
text: Your orders. Capture the leader of the rebel army in Carcino. Capture Eirika.

speaker: Glen
text: Eirika... Do you mean the princess of Renais?

speaker: Vigarde
text: Eirika invaded Carcino. She massacred the citizens of Port Kiris. Then, she fled south. Glen. Go. Crush the rebels who brought ruin to Carcino.

speaker: Glen
text: ...Understood, sire.

speaker: Cormag
text: What did the emperor say, Brother?

speaker: Glen
text: I’ve been ordered to kill the princess of Renais. Cormag, I want you to remain here in the capital. I’ll go alone.

speaker: Cormag
text: If that’s what you want, Brother, so be it. But you seem troubled... Don’t tell me you’re concerned about fighting the princess of a ruined land!

speaker: Glen
text: ...Hm... I never was able to slip anything past you, little brother. You’re right. This duty falls heavily on my shoulders, more then any other.

speaker: Cormag
text: Tell me, Brother, do you know this princess?

speaker: Glen
text: Yes. When Renais and Grado were still close... I met the girl– I met Eirika only once. We spoke briefly, but I felt she was a woman of great kindness. I cannot bring myself to believe Princess Eirika is evil. I cannot.

speaker: Cormag
text: ...Glen. The emperor has ordered–

speaker: Glen
text: There’s the rub, Cormag. That’s it exactly. His Majesty has never spoken a falsehood in all the time I’ve served him. And as a servant of the empire, I am duty bound to obey his orders. But I can see no reason to think Princess Eirika’s heart is any less gentle now.

speaker: Valter
text: What are these cowardly mutterings? It is because you three generals are weak that we others must work so hard. And yet you get the honor of killing the girl. How I long to do your duty for you!

speaker: Glen
text: Rrrr! Valter, you treacherous swine...

speaker: Valter
text: What’s this? Is this how you speak toward your peer knights of the realm? Lest you’ve forgotten, I, too, am a general–the same rank as you.

speaker: Glen
text: You wretch. You were cast out from the army for mistreating civilians. What lies have you told to receive pardon and reinstatement at the same tome?

speaker: Valter
text: Our beloved emperor felt my skills were needed, and his word is law. His majesty has earned my sincerest and most undying gratitude. And then we have you three. Duessel, Selena, and you... The three of you have proven to be unreliable time and time again. We were brought in to plug the holes, don’t you see? You ought to thank me, Glen!

speaker: Cormag
text: Valter! If you dare insult my brother further...

speaker: Valter
text: Come now, Cormag. And what would you do to me if I did? Would you fight me? Here? Would you show such disloyalty to the emperor?

speaker: Glen
text: Peace, Cormag. We are His Majesty’s men. We will honor his commands. Mark my words, Valter: your crimes are neither forgotten nor forgiven.

speaker: Valter
text: Hmph...

speaker: Gerik
text: Prince Innes. What do you say? Can you continue?

speaker: Innes
text: Yes, of course. Do you believe this is enough to make me give up? I am surprised you mercenaries haven’t turned and fled, though.

speaker: Gerik
text: Naw. You see, Gerik’s Mercenaries takes its name from me, Gerik. I’m the chief here. If I quit while our employer still fought on, they’d want a new name, you follow me? So... What’s the plan?

speaker: Innes
text: Same as before. We remain surrounded. They’re not going to allow us simply to walk out of here... I send a messenger off with news of our plight. However, even on the wings of a pegasus knight, Frelia is days away. We can expect no help from them.

speaker: Gerik
text: So we tighten our belts and survive, is that it? Or would you rather quit this place and rest in comfort?

speaker: Innes
text: Surrender? I’m the prince of Frelia. I don’t know the meaning of the words. The fate of the world rides on my shoulders, and I’ll make it to Jehanna. Even if I have to crawl to do it.

speaker: Gerik
text: Now, that makes me feel better. If you’re so determined, we may all live a little while longer...

speaker: Tethys
text: Hey, Chief, Prince.

speaker: Gerik
text: What is it, Tethys?

speaker: Tethys
text: I’ve got bad news...and then I’ve got worse news.

speaker: Gerik
text: What’s the bad news?

speaker: Tethys
text: We’ve no more weapons in reserve. What you’re holding is what we’ve got. Once those are gone, there won’t be much fight left in us.

speaker: Gerik
text: That is bad news... Well? What’s the worse news?

speaker: Tethys
text: They’ve begun to move. They’re going to attack again. Looks like they’re sending up the whole lot of ’em this time.

speaker: Innes
text: ...... Right. You two, you’re done here. Discharged. Fired. Whatever. You can surrender or flee. The choice is yours.

speaker: Gerik
text: What?

speaker: Innes
text: I’m the one they’re after. Throw down your weapons, and you’ll walk away alive. I don’t need you here. You’ll only be in my way. Who knows? You filthy sellswords’ll probably sell me out anyway.

speaker: Tethys
text: Hold on there! That’s not true, and you know it!

speaker: Gerik
text: Peace, Tethys. Hey, Prince. What are you going to do?

speaker: Innes
text: I’m going to get out of here on my own. I’ll break to the south and escape into the mountains.

speaker: Gerik
text: That ain’t gonna be easy. How you plan on doing that?

speaker: Innes
text: I’m not telling you. I’ve no idea when you’ll decide to betray me. Go on. Get out of here. I’d rather do this alone.

speaker: Gerik
text: Sounds like you’re trying to make sure you’re the only one who dies.

speaker: Innes
text: ...... Fool. I’ve no intention of dying. But there can be no false hope of reinforcements riding in to save the day. You and I are not the same. You’re a commoner, and I’m Frelia’s heir. We of noble birth do not shirk the duties to which we are born.

speaker: Innes
text: What are you waiting for? You may go.

speaker: Gerik
text: Well played, milord. I’ve always loved the melodrama of martyrdom... There’s no way I can abandon you after that fine performance. I’m staying with you. To the end.

speaker: Innes
text: To the– What are you saying? You dare ignore the orders of the one who’s paying your wages?!

speaker: Gerik
text: Tethys, I want you to go and surrender. Give my regards to Ewan and Marisa.

speaker: Tethys
text: Don’t be ridiculous. I’m not going anywhere. Now would the two of you kindly stop acting like such...men? And you! You’ve already fired us. You can’t order us to leave now.

speaker: Innes
text: Unbelievable... And you people call yourselves mercenaries? I thought you fought for money, not for duty.

speaker: Gerik
text: Yeah, that’s one of the rules. Guess we’re lousy mercenaries, eh? Now let’s get thinking. We still need a plan to get us all out of here alive. You’re supposed to be a good tactician, so I figure I won’t die easily. Tell us what to do, Prince. We’ll follow your orders.

speaker: Innes
text: ...... Hm. Very well. I’ll see what I can do to avoid getting us filled with arrows.

speaker: Tethys
text: Ah... Say, Prince. If, by some miracle, aid were to come, from what direction would it arrive?

speaker: Innes
text: ...From the north. But there’s little or no hope of that. Even if Frelia were to send us aid, they would not arrive until...

speaker: Tethys
text: This may be good news... Then again, it may be more bad news. There. On that northern mountain path... Someone’s coming.

speaker: Eirika
text: Prince Innes!

speaker: Seth
text: Princess Eirika, the prince is surrounded by the mercenary armies of Carcino. He looks vastly outnumbered. I doubt he can hold out much longer.

speaker: Eirika
text: I can see that. Let’s hurry!

speaker: Pablo
text: Heh heh... My plan to get rid of Klimt has yielded some unexpected fruit. The head of Frelia’s Prince Innes will make a fine gift to Grado.

speaker: Soldier
text: Lord Pablo, Prince Innes and his men have taken refuge in a mountain stronghold. Do we have your permission to finish them off?

speaker: Pablo
text: Yes. Flush the prince out and cut him down. We’ll find Klimt later and roast his old bones as well. Heh heh heh...

speaker: Man
text: Lord Klimt, Pablo’s troops are moving toward the stronghold. It looks like they’re planning on chasing down Prince Innes and his men.

speaker: Klimt
text: Pablo, you mad, reckless imbecile... If Prince Innes dies here, the bond between Carcino and Frelia is sundered forever. Carcino will be nothing more than a vassal paying tribute to Grado... We must find some way to aid Prince Innes.

speaker: Man
text: Wait, my lord Klimt! Pablo is after you as well. If you reveal yourself here...

speaker: Klimt
text: Ahh... May fortune keep you safe, Prince Innes...

speaker: Soldier
text: Hey! You’re up! You’re getting paid a lot more than us common soldiers. Time you earned your gold!

speaker: Marisa
text: I hear you. Where do I start killing?

speaker: Soldier
text: Th-that way! The Frelian troops! Don’t point that blade in our direction!

speaker: Marisa
text: I’ll do what I can. No promises. Good day.

speaker: Soldier
text: Whew... So that’s Marisa, the Crimson Flash of Gerik’s Mercenaries... She’s a beauty, but I’ll keep my distance...and keep my head.

speaker: Tana
text: Brother!

speaker: Innes
text: Tana?!? What? How did... What are you doing here?

speaker: Tana
text: I came with Eirika. Wait here, Brother. It’s my turn to protect you.

speaker: Innes
text: Stop playing the soldier, Tana. You will return to the palace at once.

speaker: Tana
text: I will not! Eirika, Ephraim, and you are all risking so much... I can’t sit at home and watch! I have to do something to help.

speaker: Innes
text: Tana... ...We’ll talk about this later. For now, we join forces with Eirika.

speaker: Tana
text: Thank you, Brother.

speaker: Eirika
text: Prince Innes! Are you well?

speaker: Innes
text: Eirika... Is that you?

speaker: Eirika
text: We’ve come to aid you. You must be exhausted. Please fall back and rest. We’ll take care of these dogs.

speaker: Innes
text: I cannot allow that. I will not run and hide while a woman protects me... We will continue the fight. You can join us.

speaker: Eirika
text: If that’s how you want it. Let’s go then.

speaker: Innes
text: ...Eirika, a moment.

speaker: Eirika
text: Prince?

speaker: Innes
text: I would give you my thanks. You, the princess of Renais, came to my aid... ...I am in your debt.

speaker: Innes
text: Reinforcements have arrived, Gerik.

speaker: Gerik
text: Lucky us, eh? Good thing we held out as long as we did.

speaker: Innes
text: That was your doing. Thank you.

speaker: Gerik
text: Don’t let your guard down now, Prince. There are still enemies to fight, and it’d be such a shame to die now.

speaker: Innes
text: I agree completely. Let’s go.

speaker: Gerik
text: Hey, Tethys. Looks like help is on the way.

speaker: Tethys
text: Really? Perhaps faith is a good thing. I’ve never had much before, but perhaps good things do happen to good people.

speaker: Gerik
text: Good things? I like the sound of that. What do you suppose might come my way?

speaker: Tethys
text: Ha ha... I wonder...

speaker: Innes
text: Reinforcements have arrived, Tethys.

speaker: Tethys
text: Really? Perhaps faith is a good thing. I’ve never had much before, but perhaps good things do happen to good people.

speaker: Innes
text: Faith had nothing to do with this. Let’s go. We must join them.

speaker: Tethys
text: What a strange nobleman.

speaker: Tethys
text: Say, Chief. I’ve got good news, and I’ve got better news.

speaker: Gerik
text: Eh? What’s the good news?

speaker: Tethys
text: Within our band of mercenaries... There are two women enamored of you.

speaker: Gerik
text: Huh? What’re you talking about? You a fortune-teller now? And what’s the better news?

speaker: Tethys
text: Help has arrived. Looks like we may survive after all.

speaker: Young Lady
text: Elder Pablo used his fortune to build his own private army. Now he’s using it to wrest control of Carcino from the council’s hands... Please...help Lord Klimt, so that he can help us.

speaker: Man
text: You know we have no king in the Republic of Carcino. We’re governed instead by a council of elders. It’s a lot better than any stuffy, old monarchy, I can tell you that. You see, anyone can be a leader in Carcino if he’s old enough. Of course, maybe that’s why the country’s in such a mess right now.

speaker: Young Man
text: I’ve heard that Prince Innes of Frelia is a fantastic tactician. Grado took Renais with no trouble, but Frelia still has yet to fall. They say it’s because Prince Innes has spies reporting every move the empire makes. At the same time, all enemy spies in Frelia are exposed and executed swiftly. That means that none of Frelia’s secrets are ever reported back to the empire. I’ve never met Prince Innes, but he doesn’t sound like a man you’d want as an enemy.

speaker: Gerik
text: Is that you, Marisa?

speaker: Marisa
text: Chief.

speaker: Gerik
text: What a mess... Looks like the guild bungled. They’re usually diligent about making sure this sort of thing doesn’t happen. But here we are, two people of the same troop, working for opposite sides.

speaker: Marisa
text: What should we do?

speaker: Gerik
text: Aye, well, that’s a good question... As a mercenary, your loyalty should always lie with the person paying your wages. You decide. We can cross blade if you want, but I’d rather you retreat. ‘Course, if you betray your employer, you’ll soil your sterling name.

speaker: Marisa
text: C’mon, Chief. What would YOU like me to do?

speaker: Gerik
text: Well, that’s easy. I’d like you to come over and join my side.

speaker: Marisa
text: Right. Done.

speaker: Gerik
text: Ho-hold on... Is that it? Just like that? You know what this will do to your reputation, right?

speaker: Marisa
text: Uh-huh.

speaker: Pablo
text: No one can withstand the might of Grado... Logic dictates we join now or be subjugated later. I made the rational decision. The only decision!

speaker: Pablo
text: Urrgh... N-no. I cannot die when there is such wealth to be had... Re-retreat! Mercenaries, to me!

speaker: Valter
text: ...I’ve found you, Eirika. Seems you’re as skilled as reports say. This is going to be fun. Yes, yes, yes. I do so love strong women.

speaker: Soldier
text: Shall we attack, General Valter?

speaker: Valter
text: No, we’ll pass on dessert for now. Allow them to escape. We’re leaving.

speaker: Eirika
text: Prince Innes, are you well?

speaker: Innes
text: Eirika...I’m sorry for troubling you.

speaker: Eirika
text: No, it was no trouble.

speaker: Klimt
text: Oh, Prince Innes! Thank goodness, you’re unharmed!

speaker: Eirika
text: Who are you?

speaker: Klimt
text: Oh, where are my manners? I am a member of Carcino’s Council of Elders. My name is Klimt.

speaker: Eirika
text: A council member?

speaker: Innes
text: So you’re one of the traitors who ordered–

speaker: Klimt
text: P-please, please! I have no intention of opposing you or quarreling with you. I, too, have been marked for death by Pablo...

speaker: Eirika
text: What is this all about?

speaker: Klimt
text: It’s a shameful tale... Carcino is a nation divided. As you know, Carcino has no king but is ruled by a council. But now the council has broken apart into factions mired in discord...

speaker: Eirika
text: Factions... You’re saying that the whole of Carcino has not betrayed Frelia?

speaker: Klimt
text: Correct. The moderate factions prefer to preserve our alliance with Frelia. Pablo’s faction wishes to endear us to Grado, to surrender us to their armies. Once Pablo realized he couldn’t ply us with brides, he began to have us assassinated. Those of us who remain have taken refuge underground. We oppose him where we can. If you hadn’t shown up, I’m not certain I would still be breathing...

speaker: Innes
text: I do recall enemy troops combing this area when I arrived... They were searching for you, is that it?

speaker: Klimt
text: Pablo has usurped rule of the council. We had no choice but to hide. Not all of Carcino’s council has gone over to Grado’s side, though... You must believe me–the whole of Carcino does not believe as Pablo does.

speaker: Innes
text: ...I see.

speaker: Eirika
text: Lord Klimt... I understand the hardships you’ve endured. I am pleased to hear all of Carcino is not our foe.

speaker: Klimt
text: I will depart at once for Frelia to explain our circumstance to the king. I think it is best if you return to Frelia as well. Pablo has considerable wealth, and he commands a vast mercenary force. I’m sure he’ll send more of them this way as soon as he is able.

speaker: Gerik
text: Prince Innes. Tethys and I are staying with you. Is that gonna work?

speaker: Innes
text: Yes, I would appreciate the help. Starting now, you’ve got a new contract, though–the pay’s double. If the two of you hadn’t stayed with me back there, I would not have survived. Gerik, Tethys... Thank you. You have my gratitude.

speaker: Tethys
text: Tell me something, Prince. Did you get...er...hit on the head during that last skirmish?

speaker: Innes
text: ...That’s unkind. My neck is not so stiff that I cannot show gratitude. I would ask for your continued support in the days ahead.

speaker: Eirika
text: We both ask for your help.

speaker: Gerik
text: We’ve got a deal. Let’s keep each other alive.

speaker: Ewan
text: Ah! There you are, Sister.

speaker: Tethys
text: Ewan! How is it... What are you doing here? I told you to wait in the inn and behave yourself, didn’t I?

speaker: Ewan
text: Yeah, but you always run off and disappear. It’s not fair. I want to have adventures, too.

speaker: Tethys
text: You are such an imp... I am not out here running about having fun, you know?

speaker: Ewan
text: I know. That’s why I came to see you. I can help. My teacher finally got around to teaching me some magic. Check this out.

speaker: Tethys
text: H-hey! Knock it off! You shouldn’t be using magic here!

speaker: Ewan
text: Well, I just thought maybe I could help you work is all. I can protect you now, sis. Come on, take me with you. I don’t wanna stay in that inn anymore.

speaker: Tethys
text: Oh...all right. I’ll go speak and speak to the Chief and Princess Eirika. Don’t wander off while I’m gone.

speaker: Ewan
text: Yahoo!

speaker: Seth
text: Princess Eirika, Prince Innes. I think we should follow the advice we’ve been given and return to Frelia. Continuing on through Carcino like this is too great a risk to your safety.

speaker: Innes
text: The peril is self-evident. However, I have to reach Jehanna, and the only way is through Carcino. If I don’t hurry, nations will fall, one after another, to Grado’s hunger.

speaker: Eirika
text: Innes is right. And the road to Rausten leads me through both Carcino and Jehanna. However, pressing on will only invite more mercenary attacks.

speaker: Ewan
text: Hey, I’ve got an answer. I know a way that leads over the mountains straight to Jehanna! Want me to guide you?

speaker: Eirika
text: ...And who might you be?

speaker: Tethys
text: Ewan! Shush! You know better than to interrupt people when they’re talking. I’m so sorry. Please let me take my brother out of the way. Come on, Ewan. Let’s go.

speaker: Eirika
text: No, no–wait, please. Do you really know a route through the mountains?

speaker: Ewan
text: That’s what I said. At the top of that mountain, there’s a village named Caer Pelyn. That’s where my teacher lives. I’m sure he’ll lead you through if you ask him nicely.

speaker: Innes
text: What is your teacher’s name?

speaker: Ewan
text: My teacher? His name is Saleh.

speaker: Innes
text: Saleh... I’ve heard that name on the lips of Frelia’s spy network lately. He’s a powerful wielder of magic who has been fighting bandits and monsters. The spies mentioned something about a Caer Pelyn, if I remember.

speaker: Eirika
text: What do you think?

speaker: Innes
text: Hm. If my spies are accurate, this Saleh is someone we can trust.

speaker: Eirika
text: Very well, Ewan. Will you take us to meet your teacher?

speaker: Tethys
text: Are you sure you can do this, Ewan?

speaker: Ewan
text: Not a problem! All right, everyone. See if you can keep up!

speaker: Seth
text: We’re approaching Serafew, at the border of Renais and Grado. Once we cross, we’ll be in Grado... Renvall won’t be much farther.

speaker: Eirika
text: That is, assuming we can cross the border without mishap... Oh! Look! Over there!

speaker: Eirika
text: Those strange figures... What...What are they? Are they...human? I’ve never seen anything like it. What could they be?

speaker: Artur
text: What have we done to deserve the trials before us? What is happening to us? How could such abominations walk out lands while the Sacred Stones protect us?

speaker: Artur
text: Lute, please, it’s dangerous outside the walls. Stay here in the village.

speaker: Lute
text: Those are revenants, aren’t they? They were the vanguard of the Demon King in the days of darkness. The Tome of Nazania describes them in chapter 2, section 7, paragraph 8.

speaker: Artur
text: You know of them?

speaker: Lute
text: Duh! I’m a prodigy. I can recall almost everything I see or hear. According to the book, revenants attack using razor-sharp claws. Sounds painful, wouldn’t you say?

speaker: Artur
text: Yes, er, well... Be that as it may, I must go aid those travelers outside. You should stay here within the safety of the village.

speaker: Lute
text: Very well. I don’t mind staying here. In fact, it seems that smarter choice.

speaker: Lute
text: Magic is far more powerful than any monster’s claws. The thickest hide and the strongest armor are useless against magic’s power. Yes, I supposed I could have studied swords, but only magic is worthy of me. Even if this village were to be assaulted by monsters, I could defend it perfectly.

speaker: Artur
text: Travelers, you must listen to me! The ancient forest of Za’ha is dangerous. Head south and pass through this place before the fiends surround you!

speaker: Eirika
text: Who are you?

speaker: Artur
text: My name is Artur. The temple has assigned me the task of cleansing the forest of these...things. There are so many of the fiends, though. I wonder if I stand much chance alone. So if you would, please flee now while you have the chance.

speaker: Eirika
text: Fiends? You’re not talking about the same fiends that served the ancient Demon King? That can’t be right... They’re nothing but legends and fairy tales...

speaker: Artur
text: Yes, I felt the same say when I heard. And yet here they are. This place is filled with them. I wonder how far they’re spread... Surely they’re not in Renais alone.

speaker: Eirika
text: But..why are they here? How?

speaker: Seth
text: Beware, Your Highness! Something approaches!

speaker: Artur
text: Please allow me to deal with this. Evil shade! May the blessed light drive you from this land!

speaker: Seth
text: We ought to help. He can’t fight them all alone. Do you have orders?

speaker: Artur
text: One of my companions is in that village to the south. If you can get there swiftly, I implore you to watch over her safety.

speaker: Man
text: Do you see that old snag to the south of here? Bet it would make a handy bridge if you could knock it over. Take a weapon to it and give it a few good whacks. That should do it. Here, take this and give it a try. It ought to do the trick.

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Oh, my! Those travelers are being besieged by the agents of evil!

speaker: Dozla
text: Ha ha ha! Right you are, Lady L’Arachel!

speaker: L’Arachel
text: I cannot allow this to happen! Come! We must charge down these cliffs and rush to their aid!

speaker: Rennac
text: We charge down these cliffs, and the only thing we’ll be rushing to is death. How about we find us a nice, gentle path down, hm?

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Ah...Yes, well...Let us hurry nonetheless. I simply cannot abide those wicked beasts running amok!

speaker: Artur
text: Lute, help has arrived.

speaker: Artur
text: Lute?

speaker: Lute
text: Your flesh shows no sign of putrefaction. It seems you’re not a revenant.

speaker: Artur
text: Well, I should hope not! I wanted you to know help has arrived. Please be patient a bit longer...

speaker: Lute
text: No, no. I insist on joining you in combat. I’ve been reading up on these revenants. They are, quite simply, no match for me. I am superior after all.

speaker: Eirika
text: Hm?

speaker: Lute
text: Your flesh shows no sign of putrefaction. It seems you’re not a revenant. I’ve decided to join you in battle now. My name is Lute. I’m a mage of superior wisdom and rare ability. I’ve been reading up on these revenants. They are, quite simply, no match for me. I am superior after all.

speaker: Seth
text: We’ve killed all the monsters. Still, we’d best burn the bones to ash to be sure they don’t return.

speaker: Eirika
text: I still can’t believe what we’ve been fighting here... I’d thought those fiends nothing more than myth and legend.

speaker: Seth
text: Those revenants are said to be the least of the dark creatures. And yet, the weakest of them could outmatch any normal man. We cannot take this enemy lightly.

speaker: Lute
text: Oh, yes. There are much worse then those revenants and the entombed... Let’s see, there’s the bonewalkers, mauthe doogs, gargoyles, baels... Why, I’ll bet you just about any creature of lore could be walking again. Yes, we’re in for some trouble. Even my fabulous power may not be enough.

speaker: Artur
text: O divine light, show me... Is this a sign of dark days to come?

speaker: Eirika
text: By all that’s holy, what is happening?

speaker: Seth
text: Princess Eirika, perhaps it would be wise to return to Frelia and regroup. Pressing forward seems foolish in light of recent events. We cannot face both Grado’s forces and more of those terrible things.

speaker: Eirika
text: Seth, I follow your point, and nothing would please me more then running for safety. But what of my brother? He and his men are still trapped in the same situation we are. I know full well that I may be leading us into even greater danger, but... Please try to understand.

speaker: Seth
text: I do, my princess, and I vow to see you through this safely.

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Aha! Foul creatures, beware! I, L’Arachel, bestow upon you the honor at banishment at my blessed hands!

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Oh...Where are the monsters?

speaker: Eirika
text: Well, we just finished...

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Ah, glad tidings indeed! The heavens must be rejoicing! I am.. a tad disappointed however. After all, I did rush all the way here to show you the splendor of my might.

speaker: Dozla
text: Gwah ha ha! It’s a real shame, innit, Lady L’Arachel?!

speaker: Rennac
text: What’s shameful is the way you drag us around the countryside.

speaker: Eirika
text: Pardon me, but...who are you?

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Me? Since you ask, please allow me to introduce myself. It is I, the true light and glory of the sacred realm of Rausten...

speaker: Dozla
text: Stop! Lady L’Arachel, you mustn’t continue! You cannot reveal your true identity here!

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Oh, yes, you’re right. Oh, I get so careless sometimes! Now, I must ride off in anonymity. Oh, how beautifully romantic!

speaker: Eirika
text: Uh... Right.

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Fare thee well, strangers. Perhaps our paths will cross again. Come, Dozla! Rennac! We ride!

speaker: Dozla
text: Gwah ha ha! Let’s go, Rennac!

speaker: Rennac
text: All right, all right.

speaker: Eirika
text: ...What was that about?

speaker: Joshua
text: Well, well. There’s an arena in this town. Perfect. My pocket’s feeling a bit light. Say, is that a cleric? It is! And a gorgeous one at that.

speaker: Joshua
text: Something amiss, Sister? You look flustered.

speaker: Natasha
text: Ahhh! P-pardon me.

speaker: Joshua
text: No, pardon me! I never meant to startle you. May I offer my apologies....

speaker: Natasha
text: No, it’s not necessary... It was my fault. Excuse me, I must be going... Good day to you.

speaker: Joshua
text: ...And there she goes. Not my lucky day... She was quite the beauty, too. Ah, such is life. I think I’ve time still to visit the arena, though.

speaker: Glen
text: Captain Saar of the Serafew Border Guard. How fare you? I bring orders from His Majesty. Rumor has it that Princess Eirika of Renais is making her way to Grado. You are to find her and to place her in custody immediately.

speaker: Saar
text: Yes, sir!

speaker: Glen
text: One more thing... A traitor to the empire has fled Castle Grado. We’ve received reports she is hiding somewhere here in Serafew. I don’t care if you have to tear this town apart. Find the turncoat.

speaker: Saar
text: Yes, sir, General Glen! If she resists, do we have permission to execute her?

speaker: Glen
text: ...Yes. Permission granted.

speaker: Saar
text: Understood! Grado’s will be done. The Grado Empire will repay the debt of betrayal with blood!

speaker: Glen
text: ...His Majesty relies upon you, Captain. Be sure his trust is not misplaced. That is all.

speaker: Saar
text: Yes, sir!

speaker: Glen
text: Such loyalty to the crown. If only I could hold such conviction in the righteousness of our emperor.

speaker: Cormag
text: Something troubling you, Brother?

speaker: Glen
text: No...Pay no mind to me. Come, Cormag. Let’s go. From here, we ride northeast, back to the fort.

speaker: Cormag
text: Very well.

speaker: Eirika
text: It’s been so long since I last visited Serafew. My brother and I used to pass through here en route to Grado. I remember the harmony in which the people of both countries lived. No walls divided our borders. No soldiers stood guard in high towers. The border town... It was to me a symbol of the trust between Grado and Renais.

speaker: Seth
text: ...And now, it is firmly under the thumb of Grado’s emperor.

speaker: Eirika
text: The peace I remember in this city... It seems like something from another time. It seems lost now... Forever.

speaker: Seth
text: ...The city doesn’t seem to be very heavily patrolled. They must feel it’s not worth guarding with Castle Renais under their control. We must try to not draw attention to ourselves. The west gate is undermanned....

speaker: Saleh
text: Pardon me, may I ask you a question?

speaker: Eirika
text: What is it?

speaker: Saleh
text: I’m looking for someone. Have you seen a young girl with indigo hair?

speaker: Eirika
text: Indigo hair? No...Sorry.

speaker: Saleh
text: Hmmm... Thank you. Sorry to intrude.

speaker: Eirika
text: There was something very odd about that man, wouldn’t you say?

speaker: Seth
text: He did seem unusual. He didn’t strike me as a Grado spy, but...

speaker: Soldiers
text: Catch her! Don’t let her escape! That way! She went that way!

speaker: Eirika
text: What’s that?

speaker: Seth
text: It’s coming from over there.

speaker: Eirika
text: Let’s see what the commotion is.

speaker: Soldier
text: Traitor Natasha! Surrender peacefully. Come quietly, and you may have the chance to explain yourself before His Majesty.

speaker: Natasha
text: Wait, please. You must listen to me!

speaker: Soldier
text: Take her.

speaker: Natasha
text: No, you must believe me! The emperor is not himself. You MUST be able to see that!

speaker: Soldier
text: Impugn the emperor at your peril! We’ve been ordered to execute you if you offer any resistance. But your words condemn you!

speaker: Eirika
text: That cleric is a traitor to the throne of Grado? What madness is this?

speaker: Natasha
text: Ah...

speaker: Eirika
text: Are you all right?

speaker: Natasha
text: Who are you?

speaker: Eirika
text: I’m from Renais. Why are these Grado men after you?

speaker: Natasha
text: You’re from Renais...Oh! I have something I must tell you. It’s about Grado–

speaker: Eirika
text: Wait–Grado soldiers are coming this way. We’ll have to talk later. Now we must fight!

speaker: Joshua
text: So much for my dreams of making my fortune here... First the girl, now the gold. It really isn’t my lucky day.

speaker: Soldier
text: You there! Mercenary! What are you doing here at the arena? Get back to the staging area now!

speaker: Joshua
text: C’mon, why don’t we both hit the arena? It’ll be good training, If you’re going to risk your life anyway, you may as well try to earn some gold.

speaker: Soldier
text: I’m reporting you to the captain! You’ll be lucky if he just docks your pay! Don’t forget–You can be replaced in an eyeblink, you filthy sellsword!

speaker: Joshua
text: Don’t worry, little man. I won’t forget. Work’s work, but I don’t like fighting women... Now then, what’s the rest of the day got in store for me? ...Tails huh? That’s nothing but bad luck and more bad luck...

speaker: Natasha
text: They may not want to hear what I have to say, but... I must speak with one of the Grado soldiers. Oh, if only one of them will listen to my words... Please! Grant me strength.

speaker: Brigand
text: Look at this. Now’s our chance! C’mon, lads! Let’s join the fights and steal our way through this pathetic town!

speaker: Tethys
text: Oh, hello. Did you come to see me dance? I’m sorry, but I just finished a few moments ago. Oh, by the way…Would you be interested in one of these items? A wealthy patron left me a small ransom in gifts after watching my performance. You can sell one for gold if you’d like or use them to improve your skills. I simply cannot carry all of this by myself, so please, take this one. Wealth is useless if you can’t use it to bring happiness to others, right? Thanks for dropping my. Perhaps we’ll meet again someday.

speaker: Man
text: Life in Serafew’s been harder since the Grado occupation force took over here. Serafew’s got Renais citizens as well as Grado, but it’s been hardest on us. They’ve singled out families from Renais for the most awful atrocities. Please, traveler, take this sword. It’s an armorslayer. It’ll cut through even the strongest armor. Take it and strike down that blackheart, Saar.

speaker: Natasha
text: You...You’re that man I met... Are you here to capture me? You’ve been hired to silence me, haven’t you...

speaker: Joshua
text: Yeah, Grado’s paying the bill. They want you dead, you know? But don’t feel bad. It’s not personal.

speaker: Natasha
text: Wait, please... It doesn’t matter what happens to me, but you must hear my words. The emperor of Grado is changed. He is not the man he once was. The other nations must be warned before he extinguishes all light from out lands.

speaker: Joshua
text: Hey, no offense, but I’m just a mercenary. I don’t care about Grado or its emperor. Everything you say may be true, or it may be lies. I don’t care either way.

speaker: Natasha
text: But that’s...

speaker: Joshua
text: Even so...killing a beautiful lady like you would leave a bad taste in my mouth. Tell me, do you like to gamble?

speaker: Natasha
text: What?!

speaker: Joshua
text: Gambling’s what I live for. Even when I lose, I never want to stop. Let’s have us a little wager. If you win, I’ll believe you. Heads or tails, you call it.

speaker: Natasha
text: You can’t... This is no time for games...

speaker: Joshua
text: Would you rather I get on with the job I was hired for?

speaker: Natasha
text: ...... Um, heads... No! Tails!

speaker: Joshua
text: All right. So I’m heads, and you’re tails. Here we go. ... ... ...

speaker: Natasha
text: ...... Which...Which is it?

speaker: Joshua
text: What do you know?! It’s tails. You win. Figures. I haven’t won anything all day. Well, Lady Luck has spoken. Guess I’m on your side now.

speaker: Natasha
text: Are you serious?

speaker: Joshua
text: Yeah. Sure, I might cheat, but I never worm out of a bet. It’s a rule of mine.

speaker: Natasha
text: Oh, thank heaven! Thank you, blessed light, for your protection!

speaker: Joshua
text: I got nothing against heaven, but I’m right here if you want someone to thank... No? Well , get behind me then. I’ve got to take care of these fools.

speaker: Old Man
text: In my youth, I was a knight of some renown, I’ll have you know. I’ve even crossed blades with one of Grado’s most famous generals, I have. Ah, but I’m an old man now... I’m starting to worry... What if I die without passing on my techniques? So I decided to write down what I’ve learned in a book. I have it here. You seem like a strong warrior. I’d be honored if you would accept it.

speaker: Amelia
text: Hope everyone’ well back home in Silva. Just a bit more, and I’ll be in the empire. Let’s see, I’ve got vulneraries, antitoxins... Oh! And I can’t let myself forget torches for when it gets dark. Yep! I’m all set! Now I just need to get to the capital. I’ll be the finest soldier the Grado army’s ever seen! I swear it!

speaker: Eirika
text: Hm? What’s this...

speaker: Saar
text: Enemy of the empire! Death’s too good for you!

speaker: Saar
text: Emperor Vigarde... Glory to His...Majesty...

speaker: Eirika
text: That was a tight spot.

speaker: Natasha
text: Yes, yes it was... Thank you so much. I don’t know how to repay–

speaker: Seth
text: You’re from Grado, aren’t you?

speaker: Natasha
text: Yes... My name is Natasha. I was a servant of the people at Grado’s Imperial Temple.

speaker: Eirika
text: Then why the trouble with the soldiers? Would you tell us your story?

speaker: Natasha
text: Of course... A few days past, my mentor was arrested without warning. They executed him. They said he as a traitor... But those were false accusations. The emperor had him killed–a holy man!–to keep him silent.

speaker: Seth
text: Keep him silent?

speaker: Natasha
text: Yes. My mentor told me with his final breath. The emperor plans to destroy the Sacred Stones.

speaker: Eirika
text: The Sacred Stones? Destroy them?

speaker: Natasha
text: As you must know, the Sacred Stones drove back the power of evil long ago. Even now, each of our nations is home to one of these legendary treasures. There’s one in my homeland, Grado, and one in your Renais...

speaker: Eirika
text: Yes, the Sacred Stone of Renais is still housed in our royal temple.

speaker: Natasha
text: The emperor plans to destroy the five stones, one by one...

speaker: Seth
text: Why would he do such a thing? Legend says the Sacred Stones are even now all that keep evil at bay!

speaker: Natasha
text: I cannot begin to guess his motives... You must know, our emperor was a gentle man. But one day, he changed. Utterly. Before my mentor died, he said the keepers of the Sacred Stones must be warned. I tried to slip across the border, but the soldiers spotted me...

speaker: Eirika
text: Is that what happened... What do you think, Seth?

speaker: Seth
text: I think we can trust no one from Grado. Not in these times. Not without proof. However, if what she says is true, we cannot ignore the danger we face. Destroying the Sacred Stones... We cannot allow that to happen.

speaker: Eirika
text: I agree. If only we knew if there were some reason for the emperor’s actions. I must tell you, her story chills me to the bone. I pray it is false...

speaker: Man
text: A moment, please. Are you perchance... Princess Eirika?

speaker: Eirika
text: I am.

speaker: Man
text: Oh... Thank goodness you’re safe! I can’t tell you how happy I am. And please accept my gratitude for driving off that Captain Saar. That Saar treated all the citizens of Renais with such contempt and brutality....

speaker: Eirika
text: Not here...not in this city. My brother and I spent such happy times here with Lyon...

speaker: Man
text: I beg your pardon, but it will not be long before Grado sends more troops. Please, you must go quickly.

speaker: Eirika
text: I’m so sorry. There’s nothing I can do for you now. Please forgive me.

speaker: Man
text: Do not be troubled. Princess Eirika... We will survive and wait for the day of liberation to come. There will be a day when you, Prince Ephraim, and all of Renais rise up... Until that day of glory comes, we will wait unbowed and filled with hope.

speaker: Eirika
text: Brother...

speaker: Ephraim
text: What has happened to our home? What has happened to Castle Renais? How did it come to be so ruined? So desolated?

speaker: Seth
text: Spies report that the castle is being held by the traitor Orson.

speaker: Ephraim
text: Orson... In retrospect, I realize he’s been acting odd for a while now. He seemed so... dispirited.

speaker: Seth
text: His wife passed away some six months back. The loss may have been too much for his mind to bear. His love and devotion for his wife were well known among the knights.

speaker: Seth
text: Now, he sits alone in the king’s former bedchambers. He makes no effort to govern. No one is allowed to enter the chambers, and he takes no meals.

speaker: Eirika
text: What could he possibly be doing?

speaker: Seth
text: I do not know. The spies had no insight into his behavior. He does nothing to deal with the dark creatures and bandits roaming the land. Reports say all of Renais is engulfed in chaos. Region after region is revolting, and Orson’s reign is already crumbling. Left alone, it may very well collapse under the weight of its own neglect.

speaker: Ephraim
text: We cannot allow the situation to reach that point. We’re going home, Eirika. We’re going to the castle.

speaker: Eirika
text: I hear you, Ephraim.

speaker: Myrrh
text: Um, Ephraim?

speaker: Ephraim
text: What is it, Myrrh?

speaker: Myrrh
text: I-I will fight with you. Now that Selena has returned my dragonstone to me... I’ll do what I can until its power runs out. Let’s take back your home.

speaker: Eirika
text: Are you sure about this?

speaker: Myrrh
text: For the two of you... I simply want to help.

speaker: Ephraim
text: All right. I understand. But you must make me a promise. You are never to stray from our sides. Got that?

speaker: Myrrh
text: Of course...

speaker: Orson
text: What is it, Monica? You seem so happy today. Of COURSE I know what today is. I’d never forget your birthday! I have a present for you, dear. I think you’ll like it....

speaker: Guard
text: You know something? That Orson... He gives me the creeps. What do you think he’s doing back there? I’ve heard lots of bizarre rumors from the master of the mess hall. ...Do you think he needs help? Could he be dangerous?

speaker: Guard
text: I don’t care. I’m here for the money. As long as I get paid, I’m happy. But on the subject of rumors, have you heard the stories of the secret treasure? There’s supposed to be some fabulous wealth hidden in Castle Renais. I tell you, if I find it, I’m gone.

speaker: Riev
text: Heh heh heh

speaker: Riev
text: It does my heart good to see you looking so happy, Orson. See what joy your treachery has brought you? I told you treason would be sweet.

speaker: Orson
text: Get out. This is Monica and my place. I will not have our home disturbed by anyone. I did as you asked. I betrayed Renais. My promise has been kept.

speaker: Riev
text: Heh heh heh?How long are you going to continue this nonsense? Eirika and Ephraim have joined forces. Even now, their united forces march toward the capital, toward you.

speaker: Orson
text: Eirika?

speaker: Riev
text: You can’t imagine they’ll forgive you for your treachery, can you? I expect the sin of your betrayal has shattered you entire family’s name. And after all you did to free your wife from the cold clutches of the grave?It’s a shame she’ll be sent back there dangling from the hangman’s noose.

speaker: Orson
text: No! That can’t happen–

speaker: Riev
text: Heh heh heh! Oh, but it can, and it will. Unless you do something to stop it. You understand what is required, don’t you? You have your orders, Orson. Heh heh heh

speaker: Orson
text: ...Monica, I’m sorry. I have something I must do. Please wait for me here. Oh, darling, don’t look so sad. I’ll be back soon, and then I’ll never leave. I must do this to protect our happiness. You understand that, don’t you? All right then. I’ll be back.

speaker: Riev
text: Heh heh heh! He believes that thing is his wife! Aren’t people amusing?

speaker: Lyon
text: Urr? Why? This terrible? Uh! Urr? gaa? Ahh

speaker: Riev
text: Oh my, your nasty little illness rearing its ugly little head again? There’s no need to worry. The pain will pass shortly. Leave everything to your humble servant, Riev. Heh heh heh!

speaker: Orson
text: ...I won’t let you come between us. Monica and I will live here happily together. Forever...

speaker: Orson
text: Monica...

speaker: Seth
text: Prince Ephraim, Princess Eirika. The castle has been secured. And...

speaker: Ephraim
text: What is it?

speaker: Seth
text: ...This way. This is the room Orson was holed up in.

speaker: Monica
text: ...Darling...

speaker: Ephraim
text: You, you’re Orson’s...

speaker: Monica
text: Darling. Darling. Darling...darling...darling...darling...

speaker: Ephraim
text: ...What?! This...is horrible...

speaker: Ephraim
text: This same magic was used to control Emperor Vigarde. She’s already dead, and her corpse was used to...

speaker: Eirika
text: Who? Who could...

speaker: Ephraim
text: You needn’t look any longer, Eirika. Let’s go outside.

speaker: Monica
text: Darling. Darling...darling...

speaker: Seth
text: ...You can’t say this thing is truly alive anymore. I’ll...

speaker: Ephraim
text: No... I’ll do it. ...The two of them spent every day in here, did they? Orson was mad. But I think he was happy...

speaker: Ephraim
text: We’ve finally made it back. Yet...

speaker: Eirika
text: Mmm... We can repair the castle, and what was stolen, we can do without. But the wounds and suffering inflicted upon the people of Renais...

speaker: Ephraim
text: It’s too late to undo their pain. Once I become king, I must set our country right. I doubt the people will give me a warm reception, though. I did abandon them. All I can do is try to win back their trust, no matter how long it takes...

speaker: Seth
text: Princess Eirika, Prince Ephraim. You should look outside.

speaker: Ephraim
text: Outside?

speaker: People
text: Prince Ephraim! Princess Eirika! The king has returned! Our king! Glory to Renais! Long live King Ephraim!

speaker: Seth
text: ...They’re not cheering for you. They cheer because Orson’s misrule is at an end. They cheer the possibility of a better tomorrow, not the deeds we did today. But how will the hearts of the people move tomorrow and the next day? That is for you to decide.

speaker: Ephraim
text: I will not let their hopes and dreams be shattered again. I will be king. Like my father before me, I will dedicate myself to their happiness.

speaker: Eirika
text: And I will do all I can to help, Ephraim.

speaker: Seth
text: Prince Ephraim, Princess Eirika. Before Renais fell, King Fado entrusted me with this message: Raise the twins?bracelets in the hall of kings. The seal will be broken. The resting place of the Sacred Stone will be revealed...?br>

speaker: Ephraim
text: I understand.

speaker: Eirika
text: So we’re supposed to raise our bracelets over our heads, right?

speaker: Ephraim
text: Let’s try it, Eirika.

speaker: Eirika
text: I’m ready, Ephraim.

speaker: Ephraim
text: This is the Stone of Renais...

speaker: Eirika
text: Yes. This is one of the five stones that defeated the Demon King.

speaker: Ephraim
text: If Lyon had acquired our bracelets, the stone would have been destroyed by now. Together, we protected the only power that can help us stop Lyon’s insanity.

speaker: Eirika
text: Yes. It’s the only hope left to us. Hope for you and me, and the last true hope for peace...

speaker: Ephraim
text: Let’s get back, Eirika.

speaker: Eirika
text: ...Huh? Brother, look! Our bracelets, they’re...

speaker: Ephraim
text: What is this? Are they reacting to the light of the stone? Eirika’s Lunar Brace and Ephraim’s Solar Brace glow in response to the Sacred Stone. With the power of the bracelets, the twins can now change classes.

speaker: Eirika
text: I can’t believe the bracelets contain so much power...

speaker: Ephraim
text: I wonder if Father anticipated all of this long ago. When I was growing up, I never thought about becoming king. I only wanted to be a good soldier, a good warrior. The best on the battlefield. Father never understood what I wanted, but... I never understood him, either.

speaker: Ephraim
text: It was the same when Grado invaded Renais. I should have stayed home to defend the kingdom... Instead, I raced off to fight for personal glory.

speaker: Eirika
text: Brother... I don’t think you know how well Father understood your feelings. When I last saw him, he was concerned for nothing but our safety...

speaker: Seth
text: Eirika is correct. King Fado asked after your exploits every day. He always told me what a fine king you would one day make.

speaker: Ephraim
text: Father...

speaker: Seth
text: Now Prince Ephraim, Princess Eirika. Please follow me. The Sacred Twins of Renais should be near the stone’s reliquary.

speaker: Seth
text: Ah, here we go. This lance can only be one of the Sacred Twins of Renais. Please, Prince Ephraim, take this sacred relic and feel its weight.

speaker: Ephraim
text: So this is one of our Sacred Twin relics, is it? I’ve never seen them. Look, there’s a name inscribed here. Siegmund, the Flame Lance.

speaker: Seth
text: And this blade is sister to the lance, the other Sacred Twin of legend. Princess Eirika, if you would?

speaker: Eirika
text: Of course. There’s a name carved here as well. Sieglinde, the Thunder Blade...

speaker: Eirika
text: These are the ancient weapons of our ancestors–the weapons of heroes. They were enshrined generations ago, to be used only by the king... and only in times of dire need. Such an awful power they possess, and yet we need them to restore peace. I’ve seen enough of the horrors of war, but I can’t turn my back on it. If we merely turn our eyes away, we surrender our world to atrocity. And so, I must fight. I’ll do whatever I must do to bring back the peace we once knew.

speaker: L’Arachel
text: What is happening? Have you found the Sacred Stone?

speaker: Eirika
text: Yes. Here it is...

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Wow! It truly is spectacular. This goes some way to brighten the dark shadows that loom over us.

speaker: Innes
text: Our countries? Sacred Stones have been shattered by Grado’s men. The Stone of Renais is our last remaining weapon.

speaker: L’Arachel
text: No, it’s not. You have forgotten the stone of my beloved Rausten. Remember, there were five Sacred Stones for our five nations. The Stones of Grado, Frelia, and Jehanna are gone, but hope is not. We have the Stone of Renais, after all, and that of Rausten is safe. Our road is clear, my friends. I must guide you to Rausten.

speaker: Eirika
text: You’re right. L’Arachel, we’re counting on you to lead the way.

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Of course. And you will all be welcome to stay in the palace. And, Eirika, you shall be my guest in my own private quarters! Let us be on our way.

speaker: Seth
text: Perhaps we should rest, milady. Master Saleh, is it much farther?

speaker: Saleh
text: We’re close. It’s only half a day ahead.

speaker: Seth
text: I would ask for a moment’s rest before continuing. We are all exhausted. We can go no farther today.

speaker: Eirika
text: No, Seth. I’ll be fine. We must not be delayed by my weakness.

speaker: Innes
text: Whew... Hah... I didn’t realize we’d be climbing so high.

speaker: Eirika
text: Whoops!

speaker: Saleh
text: ...As I warned you before we set out, the footing here can be treacherous.

speaker: Innes
text: Do you people truly live in this place? These barren crags seem unfit for human habitation...

speaker: Saleh
text: Material wealth brings strife. We’ve no need of these things. In this, we are of one mind with the Great Dragon.

speaker: Eirika
text: The Great Dragon?

speaker: Seth
text: Ah! Princess Eirika, watch out!

speaker: Eirika
text: More monsters... Master Saleh, do these creatures normally inhabit this region?

speaker: Saleh
text: No... Those things come from Darkling Woods. It’s been a long time since they’ve wandered this far afield. It’s as the elder says... Evil omens take many shapes.

speaker: L’Arachel
text: It looks like those fiends have noticed us as well. We should move, Eirika.

speaker: Saleh
text: I’m concerned for Ewan as well. I’ll go with you. I hope he is safe.

speaker: Ewan
text: Hey! Wa-wait a moment. We can work this out... You, uh, aren’t interested in talking, are you? Aaaaaa...

speaker: Ewan
text: Where’d all those freaks come from? I’ve got to get back and warn everyone... But... I do wonder if Grandmother is all right.

speaker: Ewan
text: Oh, Sister!

speaker: Tethys
text: Ewan! Are you all right?

speaker: Ewan
text: Yeah. I tried to fight those monsters. And you know what? I killed four of ’em! With my magic! That’s pretty good, huh?

speaker: Tethys
text: What am I going to do with you? Anyway, it’s not safe here. Come with me, Ewan.

speaker: Ewan
text: ...... You-you don’t believe me... You watch and see. I’ll show you how far I’ve come!

speaker: Saleh
text: Ewan... You’re safe.

speaker: Ewan
text: Oh, Teacher! It’s you! You probably had to fight a ton of creatures to get here! You’re the best! I hope I can study with you forever.

speaker: Saleh
text: I’ve told you before... My mission is my life. If you wish to learn magic, you’d be better served by another.

speaker: Ewan
text: No way. I wanna be just like you. Why would I go study somewhere else? Wait... You’ve gotta go out on a mission again, don’t you! Take me with you! I’ve practiced a lot. I can already use all the magic you taught me!

speaker: Saleh
text: ...... Well, you seem quite adamant. All right. You may accompany me. I think being with me might be safer than remaining on your own.

speaker: Ewan
text: Yahoo!

speaker: Ewan
text: Ah, hello!

speaker: Eirika
text: Ewan! How wonderful. So you’re safe, are you?

speaker: Ewan
text: Yep. I took care of a whole mess of those things. More of ‘em might show up at any time, so I’ll just follow you to the village. That’s all right, isn’t it?

speaker: Eirika
text: I guess so... It’s probably safer than leaving you here by yourself. Let’s stick together, Ewan.

speaker: Ewan
text: Wahoo!

speaker: Ewan
text: You were one of the people with my teacher, weren’t you? You think I can fight at your side? I can use the magic my teacher taught me. Well, what do you say?

speaker: Woman
text: I can’t believe monsters have appeared here in the realm of the Great Dragon. What is this world coming to? This staff you help to protect you against the beasts. Please travel safely.

speaker: Grandmother
text: Saleh? Is that you, Saleh? Tell me, is the Great Dragon well?

speaker: Saleh
text: I’m sorry, Elder. I searched to the west, but I found nothing.

speaker: Grandmother
text: Is that so... Hm? Who’s that with you?

speaker: Innes
text: I am Innes, prince of Frelia. The circumstances of our journey have led us here. We would like to pass through.

speaker: Eirika
text: Please.

speaker: Grandmother
text: Hmmm... We of Caer Pelyn have turned away from the world outside. The Great Dragon alone holds all our honor and esteem. In this place, princes and pauper are equals. Do you have a problem with that?

speaker: Innes
text: ...No. I understand.

speaker: Grandmother
text: Hm... Well then, be welcomed as guests in our homes. I see some of you are injured. You should use this rock moss. We have little beyond what we need, but we will prepare food and bedding. You can rest as long as you like.

speaker: Innes
text: We’ve no wish to trouble you. We’d just as soon pass straight through.

speaker: Grandmother
text: Don’t let your pride drive you to foolishness. That girl there looks like she’s ready to collapse at any moment. She’s ill from the height of the mountain. Saleh, prepare some tea for the lass.

speaker: Eirika
text: Thank you, Elder...

speaker: Grandmother
text: Call me Grandmother, child. That is what the villages call me.

speaker: Eirika
text: Uh... Grandmother, may I ask you a question? This Great Dragon...

speaker: Grandmother
text: Ah, the inquisitiveness of youth. Come, lass, listen to my words. The Great Dragon is...a blessing, one that watches over all mankind. Why, in days long past, when the Demon King appeared...

speaker: Eirika
text: Demon King? Are you speaking of the legend of the Sacred Stones? The hero Grado used the power of the five Sacred Stones to defeat and seal away–

speaker: Grandmother
text: No, no, that’s not right at all. Ah, how quickly did mankind forget its debt to the Great Dragon. To hear the story now, one would think humans alone brought about victory. That is a gross mistelling of the tale. Only through the Great Dragon’s strength could the Demon King be sealed away!

speaker: Eirika
text: The Great Dragon and the Demon King...

speaker: Grandmother
text: Mankind may have forgotten its debt, but the Great Dragon never forgets. It watches over the bones of the Demon King in Darkling Woods. It keeps the Demon King’s dark brood from swarming the world of men. The Great Dragon’s vigilance alone has kept us safe from their blind rage.

speaker: Eirika
text: Is that so? I’m... I’m sorry, I never knew...

speaker: Grandmother
text: Hmph. You don’t need to know everything, but you should remember that.

speaker: Eirika
text: Yet, Grandmother, we encountered those creatures on the way here. And they have begun to appear in the land we live in as well. What does this mean?

speaker: Grandmother
text: Ah... You have seen the effects of the omen that has appeared in the south. There is an energy there that has fouled the air and darkened the sky. The Great Dragon left Darkling Woods and went south to investigate. We of the village wished to protect the Great Dragon, so I sent my grandson, Saleh, as long as well. But they became embroiled in battle, and the Great Dragon disappeared. Since that time, there’s been no sign of the Great Dragon either here or abroad. We grew worried and directed Saleh to look for any trace of the Great Dragon. I am worried that the source of that foul energy may be responsible.

speaker: Eirika
text: A foul energy... From the south? Myrrh said something similar to this, too. Is the Great Dragon you speak of...one of the Manakete?

speaker: Grandmother
text: Manakete?!? How dare you speak so of the Great Dragon!

speaker: Eirika
text: I-I’m sorry.

speaker: Grandmother
text: But if you’ve seen the noble Myrrh, perhaps I can proceed more quickly. You see, our Great Dragon took the form of Mistress Myrrh in her travels. And you tell me that you have seen the Great Dragon yourself, lass?

speaker: Eirika
text: Yes. Myrrh was with my brother.

speaker: Grandmother
text: What?! Where is this brother of yours!?

speaker: Eirika
text: He leads a force of men against Grado. Myrrh rides beside him.

speaker: Grandmother
text: Saleh, this is urgent! You must leave for Grado at once and rescue the Great Dragon!

speaker: Saleh
text: Understood. I will...

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Oh, where are you off to? If you’re going to Grado, the swiftest route takes you through Jehanna. It would be to your advantage to join us in our journey for a time. It’s far safer then being on your own.

speaker: Saleh
text: You have a point... Mistress Eirika, protecting the Great Dragon is my duty. Please allow me to travel with you on the road ahead.

speaker: Innes
text: We are in your debt, Matron.

speaker: Grandmother
text: Not at all. All of our guidance comes from the Great Dragon. Saleh.

speaker: Saleh
text: Yes, I know. The road to Jehanna lies here.

speaker: Eirika
text: Grandmother, thank you so much for everything.

speaker: Grandmother
text: I know you’ll help the Great Dragon, but please look after Saleh as well. He’s not very personable, but he’s the only grandchild I have.

speaker: Seth
text: Princess Eirika, are you well?

speaker: Seth
text: Princess Eirika!

speaker: Eirika
text: ...Oh...Seth?

speaker: Seth
text: Yes, it’s me. Please, you must rest. If we continue like this, you’ll...

speaker: Eirika
text: No... it’s all right. We’re all suffering... We’re still completely surrounded by Grado’s armies... We may all die at any moment... I can’t lose focus now. Has anything changed?

speaker: Seth
text: Unfortunately, no. On every front, our forces meet with defeat upon defeat. Rausten’s knights are scattered and worn, and the enemy is closing in around them. And this accursed sand... Most of the units can’t get proper footing and are being slowed down. Mounted units are having the worst time, as their movement is severely limited. Princess Eirika... I ask that you leave for safety. We’ll use flying units and magic users to hold the foe here.

speaker: Eirika
text: No. I will not retreat. If I give up now... My brother would not forgive me. I’m the princess of Renais. I will fight, either to victory or to death. Brother, I...

speaker: Riev
text: Valter... You should stop playing around. If you don’t’ finish off Eirika’s forces swiftly... Her brother’s left the capital. He should be arriving here shortly. You don’t want to be fighting her still when he arrives. Trust me. We are equals here in Grado’s army. Would you like me to assist?

speaker: Valter
text: All you need to do is vanish, you disgusting old man. Eirika is mine. I won’t let you have her. She is so strong, so beautiful... She’s the prey I’ve dreamed of.

speaker: Riev
text: Heh heh heh... Your fangs are still sharp, eh? Good. Very good. Ah, Valter... You’re a beast. You’re bound to no country. You care nothing for friend or foe. Kill a man, claim a woman... You live for nothing more, you wretched beast. That’s your strength. That’s what makes you stronger than any many alive. A beast acts without remorse. Man’s morality cannot win. It’s nature’s way... The stage is all yours, Valter. Do not fail to get the girl’s bracelet. Our master demands it...

speaker: Valter
text: The time is nigh, Eirika... Come to me!

speaker: Ephraim
text: That building beyond the dunes is Jehanna Hall. I expect that’s where we’ll find Eirika and her companions. Duessel, Knoll. It’s time we rescued Eirika. I’ll need all your strength.

speaker: Duessel
text: Of course, Your Highness. I’ve pledged my service and my axe. You shall have both.

speaker: Knoll
text: Princess Eirika... She’s a friend of Prince Lyon’s, isn’t she? I’ll do what I can to help you. I feel like that is what Prince Lyon would want.

speaker: Ephraim
text: The enemy’s numbers are great, but we do not need to face them alone. We must move quickly to join forces with Eirika and her company. I’m sure Seth and Innes will be there waiting for us. Let’s move!

speaker: Man
text: According to this ancient document... ...There was a huge battle here long, long ago. Every day, I’m out here digging up ancient weapons and artifacts out of the sand. There are still more to be found, of that you can be sure. It’s even said a long-dead sage left a copy of Metis’s Tome out here... Oh! But I won’t give that to anyone if I find it. Not a chance!

speaker: Young Man
text: All the highest generals in Grado’s army receive titles named after gemstones. The emperor currently has six gemstones fighting in his service. Caellach, the Tiger Eye, commands the forces fighting here. The Moonstone, Valter, is taking part in this battle as well. Glen, also known as the Sunstone, died in the mountains of Carcino. Selena Fluorspar was killed in western Grado. Duessel, whom they call Obsidian, is missing in action... The Blood Beryl, whose real name is Riev, has also gone missing. Hm? How do I know all this? I know I may look young and naive, but this is my job. I’m here to pass this information along to help you out. And it’s good information, too, so don’t waste it.

speaker: Old Woman
text: Jehanna Hall...has fallen. I wonder what’s become of Queen Ismaire. You there... Take this, and do some good with it.

speaker: Ephraim
text: Eirika!

speaker: Eirika
text: Brother? Is that really you? You’re not some phantom, are you?

speaker: Ephraim
text: No, it’s really me. Hold. Enemies approach.

speaker: Eirika
text: ...Ephraim. Even when we were children, you were always there to protect me.

speaker: Innes
text: It’s been a long time, Ephraim.

speaker: Ephraim
text: Innes, is that you?

speaker: Innes
text: You arrived sooner than I’d expected. Eirika is safe. You’ve no need to worry.

speaker: Ephraim
text: I’ve heard that you’ve been watching over Eirika. I should like to offer you my gratitude.

speaker: Innes
text: It’s not necessary. Besides, there’s still a war to be won. We can’t rest easy till every last Grado soldier’s been defeated.

speaker: Ephraim
text: You’re right. Let’s go!

speaker: Caellach
text: You’re a stepping-stone... And I’m moving up. Don’t take it personally.

speaker: Caellach
text: Bla-Blast... A bit more, and...a crown... would have been...mine...

speaker: Valter
text: I’ve no use for these bloodless minnows... Give me prey that will sate my bloodlust... I hunger!

speaker: Valter
text: Urggh... Gaaaah!

speaker: Eirika
text: Brother!

speaker: Ephraim
text: Eirika!

speaker: Eirika
text: Oh, Ephraim... I’ve missed you so.

speaker: Ephraim
text: And I’ve missed you. I can’t tell you how happy I am to see you safe. Oh, I almost forgot. I have something to give you.

speaker: Eirika
text: What are these?

speaker: Ephraim
text: These are called Sacred Twins. We took these relics from Grado. The dark tome Gleipnir and the black axe Garm... I doubt either of us can use them, but... Why not see if one osf your companions can use them. They might have better luck.

speaker: Eirika
text: They’re from Grado? Does this mean Grado Keep has fallen?

speaker: Ephraim
text: Yes. I conquered the capital and defeated Emperor Vigarde. But still...

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Eirika, may I make a suggestion? We’ve been able to join forces here so... How about if we all get together and trade information. There are people on both sides waiting after all.

speaker: Ephraim
text: I see unfamiliar faces among you here, so allow me to introduce myself. I am Ephraim, Eirika’s brother and crown prince of Renais.

speaker: L’Arachel
text: I’m Princess L’Arachel of Rausten. The pleasure is mine, of course.

speaker: Ephraim
text: I’ll begin by telling you of how we’ve fared in our mission. We seized the Grado capital and defeated her emperor, Vigarde. Grado’s capital guard have, to a man, surrendered and laid down their arms. Pockets of resistance remain, but the war itself is over.

speaker: Innes
text: Is that so?

speaker: Ephraim
text: However, something remains that still bothers me. A Grado man named Knoll told me about something called a Dark Stone.?Their mages had uncovered lore that led them to craft a powerful magic stone. This Dark Stone may have been the catalyst of Grado’s transformation. It seems to be the source of that black wave of energy Myrrh described. Vigarde died some time ago, but the power of the stone played him like a puppet. The war and everything that passed since was planned by the Dark Stone’s master.

speaker: Innes
text: Well? Who is it?

speaker: Ephraim
text: ...I still can’t believe it, but I’ll tell you nonetheless. According to Knoll, the man behind this is Lyon, the imperial prince. He said Lyon’s got the Dark Stone.

speaker: Innes
text: Figures it’s Prince Lyon...

speaker: Eirika
text: No, that doesn’t make any sense. Ephraim and I know Lyon better than that. We’ve been friends for years. Lyon’s not the sort of person who could start a war like this.

speaker: Innes
text: But, Eirika...

speaker: Eirika
text: I saw Lyon recently. Ephraim, you might know this, but after I abandoned the sea route to Rausten, I traveled overland with Prince Innes to Jehanna. We ran into trouble with Grado’s forces, and I chanced upon Lyon. He didn’t share the details of his situation, but he intimated that he was on our side. Despite all appearances, he was on our side. So Lyon...

speaker: Ephraim
text: Eirika, I also met Lyon.

speaker: Eirika
text: Did you really?

speaker: Ephraim
text: Yes. But, he was like a completely different person. To be honest, he didn’t seem to be completely...human.

speaker: Eirika
text: Ephraim... What are you saying?

speaker: Ephraim
text: I’ll tell you what I saw. I found Lyon inside Grado Keep. This is what he told me: He said he was behind this war. He said he’d befriended us solely so that, one day, he could invade Renais... He told me he killed our father.

speaker: Eirika
text: That... That can’t...

speaker: Ephraim
text: I know. I can’t believe it either. I refuse to believe it. How could he have planned all this since he was a child... I simply can’t fathom it. I’ve heard Lyon changed when he acquired the Dark Stone. I’ve no interest in magic, but... There was something uncanny about him. It seemed almost as though he were being controlled by something himself.

speaker: Innes
text: The two of you might find this hard to accept, but... The state of Prince Lyon’s heart matters little. He has the Dark Stone. That rock is the cause of all that’s happened. The prince must be stopped.

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Not yet. There is something that needs doing first.

speaker: Eirika
text: L’Arachel?

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Prince Ephraim, I do believe you felt it as well. The Dark Stone held by Prince Lyon... It exudes a malefic miasma... We might be able to handle Prince Lyon alone, but that stone is beyond our ken.

speaker: Eirika
text: Then what do you suggest?

speaker: L’Arachel
text: The Sacred Stones.

speaker: Eirika
text: The Sacred Stones?

speaker: L’Arachel
text: We’ve all heard the legend of the five Sacred Stones. They alone possessed the power to seal the Demon King away forever. So, of course, to dispel demonic magic, we must use the Sacred Stones!

speaker: Innes
text: You expect us to pin the outcome of this war on some fool legend?

speaker: Ephraim
text: ...Not just the legend. We also have hope. According to Lyon, he has already seen to the destruction of Grado’s, Frelia’s, and Jehanna’s stones.

speaker: Eirika
text: Hm. That explains something... Grado forces attacked me, intent on destroying the Stone of Renais. If that could be the reason they chose to invade Renais... The power of the Sacred Stones may be greater than we’d ever known.

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Yes, exactly! If we acquire a Sacred Stone, we’ll be able to oppose the Dark Stone’s might!

speaker: Innes
text: But three of the stones have been shattered, and our options are few. Do you suppose that, during the invasion of Renais...

speaker: Ephraim
text: No, I don’t think so. The Stone of Renais is hidden by the power of Eirika’s and my bracelets.

speaker: Eirika
text: Grado has made many attempts to take our bracelets. Every one has failed, and so the stone may still be safe.

speaker: Ephraim
text: We have to confirm that, of course. We’ve defeated Grado, and we must turn our eyes to our homeland. It’s time to return to Renais.

speaker: Saleh
text: Lady Myrrh.

speaker: Myrrh
text: Saleh...

speaker: Saleh
text: I’m grateful to see you well. The people of Caer Pelyn will be overjoyed that you’re safe.

speaker: Myrrh
text: I must apologize to you, Saleh. You were there to protect me from the very start of my journey. When we were attacked, I was separated from you, and... I’m so sorry to have worried you.

speaker: Saleh
text: Lady Myrrh. As long as you are safe, we have nothing to be worried about. It will be my honor to serve you until your mission is complete.

speaker: Myrrh
text: Thank you, Saleh.

speaker: Orson
text: This way, Princess Eirika. Prince Ephraim is being kept in a cell back here.

speaker: Eirika
text: Very well, let’s go.

speaker: Seth
text: ...Sir Orson. How long ago were you taken prisoner?

speaker: Orson
text: Some two weeks past. Prince Ephraim and I were forced to surrender. We’ve been held captive here in this dungeon since that black day.

speaker: Seth
text: Did you gain any news from your captors during that time?

speaker: Orson
text: Unfortunately, no. Not a word... Our daily meal was brought to us by servants from the neighboring village. They were instructed not to speak to us, and we heard nothing of the war. Tell me, Seth. How fares Renais?

speaker: Seth
text: ...Renais has fallen. King Fado... The king is dead.

speaker: Orson
text: Dead... My King... My apologies, Princess Eirika. I have served you poorly....

speaker: Eirika
text: You’re not to blame, Sir Orson. We must look to the future, not find fault in the past. The Grado army pursues me in hopes of acquiring my bracelet. My brother wears this bracelet’s twin, and he is in danger, too.

speaker: Orson
text: Bracelet? Ah, I remember... Prince Ephraim still wears the bracelet. And Grado is after them? If that’s the case, Princess... Perhaps you should entrust the bracelets to someone else.

speaker: Eirika
text: Perhaps, but...

speaker: Orson
text: Give them to me or Seth. Let someone you trust guard them. If the empire desires you bracelet, you are in danger as long as you hold it. For your own safety, Your Highness, please. What say you? We must not allow the Sacred Stone of Renais to be taken.

speaker: Eirika
text: Everything you say is true and sensible, yet...

speaker: Seth
text: ... Sir Orson. I am sorry for this, but please give me your weapons.

speaker: Eirika
text: Seth?

speaker: Orson
text: What are you talking about, Seth? Can’t you see I’m unarmed? Do you think they allow prisoners weapons? What kind of injury have you taken that you suggest such foolishness?

speaker: Seth
text: If I am mistaken, then I will give you all due apologies. However, there are questions I have that I cannot answer. Too many questions. Why did no enemy reinforcements come from the castle during our battle outside? Why would you escape your cell and yet leave Prince Ephraim in chains? How do you know of the tie between the bracelets and the Sacred Stone?

speaker: Orson
text: Seth, there is some misunderstanding here. I...

speaker: Seth
text: And why... Why do you conceal a blade within your doublet?

speaker: Eirika
text: ...What?

speaker: Orson
text: ...Very well. You haven’t changed a bit, Seth. If only Eirika had been alone. You, however, simply will not be deceived.

speaker: Eirika
text: Orson! What is the–

speaker: Seth
text: Orson. Why did you betray Renais?

speaker: Orson
text: My fondest with will be granted... To spend the rest of my days in the embrace of my loving wife once more...

speaker: Eirika
text: What are you saying?

speaker: Tirado
text: That’s enough. You’ve done well, Orson. I’ll take over now. You may return to your beloved wife.

speaker: Seth
text: Who are you?

speaker: Tirado
text: We’ve never met. I am Tirado. Loyal and talented aide to Valter, general of the Grado army.

speaker: Seth
text: You’re that monster’s–

speaker: Tirado
text: And you are General Seth of Renais, yes? I thought to catch a little bird in my net, and it seems instead I’ve snared a hawk.

speaker: Eirika
text: Where is my brother?!

speaker: Tirado
text: Ah, yes. Your brother. He’s not here. The coward fled Lord Valter’s pursuit... Somehow, he escaped the castle. And escaping under these conditions... Tch! Such stubbornness is quite annoying. It was my cunning that led us to turn this unfortunate blunder to our advantage. I spread the rumors myself. I led the villagers to believe he was our prisoner. What better trap with which to catch his sweet, devoted sister?

speaker: Eirika
text: My brother escaped?

speaker: Tirado
text: Yes, but your no-doubt emotional reunion will have to wait until the afterlife. Let’s end this, shall we? First, to destroy the bridge and cut off your only avenue of escape... All soldiers to arms! Kill the princess! Take her bracelet!

speaker: Seth
text: Princess Eirika, we have to get away from this place!

speaker: Eirika
text: But how? The bridge is gone!

speaker: Seth
text: Blast!

speaker: Eirika
text: Oh, Brother... I’m so sorry... I...

speaker: Ephraim
text: Eirika!

speaker: Kyle
text: Prince Ephraim, I hear sounds from the east corridor. Sounds like fighting.

speaker: Forde
text: Do you think it could be General Seth and Princess Eirika?

speaker: Ephraim
text: We have two goals here, men: save Eirika and vanquish the enemy. Kyle. Forde. Are you ready?

speaker: Kyle
text: Yes, Your Highness.

speaker: Forde
text: As always.

speaker: Kyle
text: Lord Ephraim, we should join forces with Princess Eirika first. We should be able to reach them by way of the eastern corridor.

speaker: Forde
text: Come now, Kyle. That seems like a lot of trouble when we could just crush Grado between us.

speaker: Kyle
text: A lot of trouble? Forde, you’re as insolent as you are careless! If anything were to happen to Princess Eirika, we Knights of Renais would...

speaker: Forde
text: Fine, fine. I see where you stand. Calm down, before you boil over. Prince Ephraim will decide. How shall we proceed, Your Highness?

speaker: Kyle
text: We await your command, Prince Ephraim.

speaker: Ephraim
text: Both of you, follow me!

speaker: Ephraim
text: Eirika, are you well?

speaker: Eirika
text: Brother!? Is it really– You’re alive! You’re alive!

speaker: Ephraim
text: Well, of course I am. After we escaped Renvall, I thought I’d strike a blow against the emperor himself. When I heard that you’d been waylaid by the enemy, however, I turned back to find you. Looks like my timing was impeccable.

speaker: Eirika
text: I’m so sorry. The irony is that I was trying to rescue you. All I did was interfere with your plans...

speaker: Ephraim
text: What are you talking about? You came to help me, didn’t you? Your efforts alone are enough to inspire me. Come on, Eirika! The enemy awaits.

speaker: Eirika
text: All right!

speaker: Seth
text: Prince Ephraim.

speaker: Ephraim
text: General Seth! You’re safe!

speaker: Seth
text: Princess Eirika is safe as well. I’m afraid I have much news to relate to you. That will have to wait, though. For now, we must cut our way out of here.

speaker: Ephraim
text: Yes. Let’s conclude our business here before we talk of other matters. Come on!

speaker: Seth
text: Yes, sire!

speaker: Franz
text: Brother!

speaker: Forde
text: Ha! Franz! How’ve you been?

speaker: Franz
text: I should ask you! We’d heard you were captured by Grado’s men. I was worried.

speaker: Forde
text: Worried? I ride with Prince Ephraim, little brother. Death will have a tough time catching anyone who rides with our prince! But it’s not like we’ve avoided trouble altogether, that’s for sure. Hm? Say, have you grown taller on me?

speaker: Franz
text: I have. I’ve also finished my training. I’m now a sworn Knight of Renais. You just watch–I’m going to be on par with General Seth one day!

speaker: Forde
text: You want to be like the general, eh? ...What about me?

speaker: Franz
text: Oh I... I still want to be like you, too, Brother!

speaker: Kyle
text: General Seth!

speaker: Seth
text: Well met, Kyle. I never thought for a moment that you could be bested easily.

speaker: Kyle
text: No, sir! And I never doubted that I would see you again.

speaker: Seth
text: Kyle. About Orson...

speaker: Kyle
text: We heard it all. Unbelievable, isn’t it? But facts are facts.

speaker: Seth
text: Yes. If Orson can turn his back on Renais... We remaining knights will have to work all the harder to prove ourselves! Let’s go, Kyle.

speaker: Kyle
text: Yes, sir!

speaker: Tirado
text: Hmm... My men were unable to finish the job, were they? It falls on me to show you my own special brand of power.

speaker: Tirado
