text: Very...impressive... However... I expect you’ll wish you’d died here on my steel. Lord Valter is...not nearly as merciful as I...

speaker: Eirika
text: Brother...

speaker: Ephraim
text: I worried you, didn’t I, Eirika? And you as well, General?

speaker: Seth
text: Not at all. We’re happy you’re safe. But tell me, Prince, do you know of Orson’s treachery against you and all of Renais?

speaker: Ephraim
text: Yes, though I learned of it all too late, after we’d been trapped at Renvall. I still find it difficult to believe that after all his years of service to Renais... I am morally responsible for his plight.

speaker: Eirika
text: Ephraim...

speaker: Myrrh
text: ...Ephraim.

speaker: Ephraim
text: What is it, Myrrh?

speaker: Myrrh
text: Something’s coming... It’s drawing near. Dark...big...and great in number.

speaker: Ephraim
text: I understand. It looks like we should get out of here.

speaker: Eirika
text: Um, Brother? This girl... Her hair is indigo... Where did...

speaker: Ephraim
text: Ah, that’s a long story. For now, we must move. Suffice to say Emperor Vigarde has enlisted some... otherworldly powers. We must warn everyone of the danger.

speaker: Cormag
text: My brother is...dead? That can’t be! That’s impossible!

speaker: Valter
text: There’s no mistake. Look for yourself. I’ve brought his corpse with me. That’s him right over there, isn’t it?

speaker: Cormag
text: No... Brother...

speaker: Valter
text: Not a pretty sight, eh? You’ll be hard pressed to ready that for a proper burial. But listen, Cormag. There’s no reason for you to grieve. After all, who is better than you to replace your brother in His Majesty’s service? Picture it: General Cormag, the new and improved Sunstone, eh?

speaker: Cormag
text: Who did this... Who is responsible? Who!?

speaker: Valter
text: Glen’s last orders were to find and subdue Eirika. ‘Tis a pity I was delayed. I arrived to witness the final blow myself. I watched Eirika run her blade right through his chest and then flee.

speaker: Cormag
text: Eirika?! Where is she now?

speaker: Valter
text: Hm? What would you do if I told you? Without orders from His Majesty...

speaker: Cormag
text: ANSWER ME!

speaker: Valter
text: ...In the eastern mountains of Carcino. The forests are thick in that region. It won’t be easy finding her, but...

speaker: Valter
text: Gone already? I’ve sent a gift your way, Eirika, but I trust you can handle it. You’re my girl after all. I need you to be strong for me... Heh heh... ha ha ha ha ha!

speaker: Messenger
text: Messenger! Messenger! I bring word from Frelia!

speaker: Innes
text: Go on. What news do you bring?

speaker: Messenger
text: Prince Innes! You’re alive and well! When the reinforcements rode into Carcino, you were nowhere to be seen... We thought perhaps the enemy forces had reached you and... It’s good to see you well, milord.

speaker: Innes
text: I’m sorry to have troubled you. But remember, the duty I bear is a harsh master. It will not let me die easily.

speaker: Messenger
text: Of course. Prince Innes...

speaker: Innes
text: Yes, what word do you bring of Frelia? Speak!

speaker: Messenger
text: Yes, Your Highness! Frelia has invaded Carcino and engaged the traitor Pablo’s mercenary army. With aid from the elder Klimt, we are crushing the foe where we find them. Pablo’s faction is retreating ever southward, toward Jehanna...

speaker: Innes
text: Towards Jehanna? They must be planning to join with the Grado forces there.

speaker: Eirika
text: Pardon me, but I must know... Do you have word of my brother?

speaker: Messenger
text: Yes. Prince Ephraim has forced them surrender of Grado’s fortress at Rigwald. He is now marching onward toward the imperial capital.

speaker: Eirika
text: Toward the capital...

speaker: Innes
text: That fool... Emperor Vigarde himself and his imperial guard are in the capital. It’s too strong a force... Even for Ephraim.

speaker: Eirika
text: No... I believe in my brother. I know he fights still. The bracelet tells me so.

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Ah, Eirika. Is it time to go already?

speaker: Eirika
text: L’Arachel. We’re going to break through the Grado lines and join the army of Jehanna. You should keep to the rear where it’s safe...

speaker: L’Arachel
text: No, I will stay with you. Confronting evil boldly is the sworn duty of any ally of justice. And it may be that Grado’s goal is the Stone of Jehanna... I cannot stand by and let it be destroyed.

speaker: Eirika
text: L’Arachel? Where did you come by such information?

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Hm? That...uh, well...the...wind whispered to me in the night.

speaker: Eirika
text: The wind? Whispered to you?

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Yes, that’s right. ...And according to that gentle breeze, there are knights riding this way from Rausten even as we speak. If we can but hold out until they arrive, the battle will surely be ours. Come, Eirika. Let us be on our way.

speaker: Eirika
text: W-wait a moment. L’Arachel? Who are you?

speaker: Caellach
text: They should be arriving anytime now. Are you ready, Aias?

speaker: Aias
text: Mm. Everything’s in place. This Princess Eirika supposedly defeated General Glen. I wonder... If it’s true, then she’s a foe to be reckoned with, and no doubt. Still, there’s no reason to worry. I can best her. I know it.

speaker: Caellach
text: You’ll take her, I’ve no fear. We fought as mercenaries together, and I know what you’re capable of. I could search the continent over and not find a man to match your skills.

speaker: Aias
text: I’m honored to hear you say that. But I’ve no interest in the titles and trapping of Grado’s Imperial Army.

speaker: Caellach
text: Don’t say that. You’re glad you came with me, right? You know we were both sick to death of living like desert rats. I’m going to be king one day. This war is just the beginning.

speaker: Aias
text: Ah... It starts again.

speaker: Caellach
text: Word has it that the Knights of Rausten are riding from the north. They’re mine. I can trust this mess to your capable hands, can’t I, Aias?

speaker: Aias
text: You remember what they called me when we were mercenaries, don’t you? I was never once wounded on the field of battle. Not once... My skill is not garnish and loud like yours, but I’ve never known defeat.

speaker: Caellach
text: Yes, that is true. I’m depending on you, Aias.

speaker: Aias
text: ..... All units prepare for battle.

speaker: Seth
text: Princess Eirika. The enemy is arrayed before us. We’ve word that Pablo’s mercenary army is closing in from the rear. You must be cautious.

speaker: L’Arachel
text: All we have to do is hold them off until the Knights of Rausten arrive. If we can do that, victory is as good as ours. Let’s get started, shall we, Eirika?

speaker: Eirika
text: Indeed!

speaker: Aias
text: It’s not over yet. Victory still hands in the balance. They key is defeated the enemy commander, but...

speaker: Aias
text: Very...impressive. You’ve pierced the battle formations I’d perfected... No one’s ever done that. Renais’s tactician has earned my highest regard.

speaker: Soldier
text: Rausten Knights?! No... All troops! Retreat at once!

speaker: Cormag
text: You’re Eirika, aren’t you?

speaker: Eirika
text: And you’re...

speaker: Cormag
text: You don’t know me, but you know my brother well enough. I’m Cormag. I’m the brother of Glen, general of the Grado army, whom you killed?

speaker: Eirika
text: What?

speaker: Cormag
text: This is no longer war, and this is not a battlefield. This is a duel, and I fight to avenge my brother. He died in combat, and I’ll not foul his name by murdering you unarmed. But I will have vengeance.

speaker: Eirika
text: Hold! What is the meaning of this? Glen... Are you telling me General Glen is dead?

speaker: Cormag
text: Do not play me for a fool! You will not... Your lies do nothing but stain your honor. Nothing more.

speaker: Eirika
text: You’ve got it wrong! You’re making a mistake. Your brother and I never fought. He lowered his lance and left the battlefield to confront your emperor.

speaker: Cormag
text: ...My brother? You lie! Where is your proof?

speaker: Eirika
text: I’ve no proof. But... Here are the words he spoke to me. He told me he believed I possessed a gentle heart when we met before. He said I had not lost that quality...

speaker: Cormag
text: ..... I see... Those are indeed my brother’s words. But then who? Who benefits from– ...Ah! ...Valter!

speaker: Eirika
text: What is it?

speaker: Cormag
text: ...Princess Eirika of Renais. I would be your ally.

speaker: Eirika
text: What?

speaker: Cormag
text: I don’t care why you’re fighting. I’ve no interest in your goals. I want nothing but revenge, and I will have it. If I can kill Valter with these two hands, what care I if Grado brands me a traitor?

speaker: Soldier
text: Elder Pablo, there’s fighting ahead.

speaker: Pablo
text: Grr...I’ve misread the situation. I can’t believe I’ve been forced out of Carcino. It’s those accursed Frelia Knights riding down on us from the north. If things don’t change quickly, I’ll be forced to appeal to Grado for aid. We must prove ourselves worthy allies of Grado. We must have them in out debt! First, I’ll use my magic to bury those enemies in the distance.

speaker: Pablo
text: Grrr... I’ve got more money then you’ve ever seen. What say you? Join me, and take a seat of power at my side.

speaker: Pablo
text: Argh... It can’t be...I... You can’t have my gold... It’s all...mine...

speaker: Aias
text: Rausten knights?! That means Caellach’s– Curses... All troops! Retreat at once!

speaker: Soldier
text: Forward the lances! Show them the might of Rausten!

speaker: Eirika
text: The Knights of Rausten! Just as L’Arachel said... Reinforcements have arrived in Jehanna!

speaker: L’Arachel
text: What I’d like to know is what took them so long! However, it seems that all has worked out in the end.

speaker: Soldier
text: Princess! Knights of Rausten, 2nd battalion, reporting for duty!

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Well done. You may lift your eyes.

speaker: Eirika
text: Princess? L’Arachel, you’re a–

speaker: L’Arachel
text: What? Oh, you mean... Don’t be silly. This is nothing. Please don’t concern yourself.

speaker: Dozla
text: I do believe, milady, that your disguise has been penetrated.

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Oh... I suppose there’s naught to be done about it now. Very well, Eirika. You’ve found me out! The beauteous wanderer who’s been your boon companion is none other then... the jewel of the theocracy of Rausten, Princess L’Arachel herself! I was acting under divine order to strike down evil in this land.

speaker: Eirika
text: ..... Is that so? But why did you...

speaker: Soldier
text: The truth is... The princess was enflamed by the words of the court troubadour, Saaga... She forced us to allow her to journey forth anonymously on a quest for justice.

speaker: Eirika
text: I-I see...

speaker: Soldier
text: Princess. This is from King Mansel.

speaker: L’Arachel
text: What’s this? War funds? Oh, what a grand uncle. He’s just so thoughtful. Princess Eirika of Renais. Rausten will not yield to Grado. Together, let us defeat the empire in the name of righteousness!

speaker: Seth
text: Princess Eirika. Princes Innes. I’ve received word from the front. The palace of Jehanna was attacked by Grado forces and has surrendered.

speaker: Innes
text: What? How did that...

speaker: Eirika
text: And the queen? Is she safe?

speaker: Seth
text: That remains unknown.

speaker: Innes
text: She may yet live. We must hurry.

speaker: Seth
text: The palace has already been occupied by imperial troops. The Grado army is being led by Lyon, the imperial prince.

speaker: Eirika
text: Lyon?!

speaker: L’Arachel
text: What it is, Eirika?

speaker: Eirika
text: It’s nothing... ...Lyon...

speaker: Caellach
text: Hey, Aias.

speaker: Aias
text: Caellach...

speaker: Caellach
text: That was something awful. I never expected to see you get beaten so roundly.

speaker: Aias
text: Yes. It was a complete failure. The Rausten knights arrived far more quickly then I’d anticipated. But it doesn’t matter, does it? Whether I won or lost? You were planning on abandoning me from the start, weren’t you?

speaker: Caellach
text: ...Yeah, sorry. I’m not going to let things end for me here. I want to rise... To climb higher and higher. I will not be chained to my past. I will not be chained to you. I truly apologize, but you die here. Good-bye, my friend.

speaker: Riev
text: So, tell me... You have ascertained Eirika’s whereabouts, have you not?

speaker: Novala
text: I have. I sent some of our men to follow the princess as she fled Serafew. They tell me Eirika and her friends will be coming this way shortly. Our ambush is ready and waiting. There’s no way they can escape. Like rats in a sack, as they say. Heh heh heh...

speaker: Riev
text: Very good... Won’t that wretched Valter be delighted. Now about this Princess Eirika... I hear she’s quite a handful. They say her paladin withstood Valter’s lance... Tell me, Novala, are you certain you can handle this assignment?

speaker: Novala
text: Don’t worry. Everything is under control. I’ve brought along a certain something from Renais. It will negate whatever futile resistance they offer. Ha ha ha...

speaker: Riev
text: Heh heh heh... Pray it goes as you say. Very well. Do what you must. I must return to the capital.

speaker: Novala
text: Will you not stay and see how Eirika looks in captivity?

speaker: Riev
text: Unlike two other layabouts I know, I do not have such time to waste. I have much to do for out master. A mountain of tasks awaits me. My time is far too precious to waste on the likes of that royal whelp. Trifles such at these are best left in the hands of servants...such as you.

speaker: Novala
text: Y-yes, of course... Then...travel well.

speaker: Novala
text: Hmph... Freakish old man. You should have watched. You might have learned something. I will capture the princess, and I will replace you at our master’s side. You will stew in regret, and I will enjoy every moment.

speaker: Novala
text: Ha ha ha... Princess Eirika of Renais! Accept your fate. You have nowhere to flee!

speaker: Eirika
text: What?! Who are you? And where...where did you come from?

speaker: Novala
text: You’re as beautiful as I’d heard... And you’re even wearing your bracelet. I suppose we should begin there. Would you surrender your lovely little trinket?

speaker: Seth
text: Ah!

speaker: Eirika
text: My bracelet... Why do you want it?

speaker: Novala
text: His Majesty desires it. That’s reason enough. Once I present it to him, he will make me a general, and I will be famous. Come, hand it over. Do it quickly, and I’ll leave you alive.

speaker: Seth
text: Princess Eirika, you will do no such thing.

speaker: Eirika
text: Of course not.

speaker: Novala
text: Obedience will save you pain. You came all this way to aid Prince Ephraim, have you not? A fool’s errand. Ephraim fell before the empire’s might. As we speak he wastes away in a cell in Renvall, meekly awaiting his execution.

speaker: Eirika
text: My brother?! You lie! A pitiful worm like you could never defeat my brother!

speaker: Novala
text: Bah. Protest all you like. It does not change the truth. Ephraim has lost, and it was Grado that defeated him!

speaker: Novala
text: You’re not going to acquiesce, are you? Very well. Bring me the child.

speaker: Girl
text: H-help me...

speaker: Eirika
text: Ah!

speaker: Novala
text: Look familiar? She’s a citizen of your precious Renais. Now give me the bracelet! Do it, or the child dies!

speaker: Eirika
text: No, please... You win. But I must have your word the child will suffer no harm.

speaker: Seth
text: Princess, wait. That bracelet–

speaker: Eirika
text: It’s not worth a child’s life. Forgive me, Seth.

speaker: Novala
text: Yes...there can be no mistaking it! Next, your weapons. Take them off and hand them over.

speaker: Seth
text: No. Surrendering our weapons would be tantamount to suicide. You demand too much of us.

speaker: Novala
text: I see years of peace and idleness have not dulled the wits of all Renais’s knights. Well then, my hostage has no more use to me, does she? Ah, such a waste. Wait a moment... I’ve just had a delicious idea. Have you heard of the giant spiders prowling about this region? They’d appreciate a nice, hot meal, wouldn’t you agree?

speaker: Eirika
text: You can’t–

speaker: Girl
text: Nooo!

speaker: Novala
text: Ha ha! This will be a delight to watch! These fools will curse the day they were born to Renais!

speaker: Eirika
text: Why...why would you... How can you do such a thing?

speaker: Novala
text: This is WAR! There are no rules here! In war, you can do anything! Anything! You curs of Renais have lost! Your idiotic ravings mean nothing...

speaker: Eirika
text: Enough. Hold your tongue.

speaker: Novala
text: Wha...what?!

speaker: Eirika
text: I... We, the people of Renais, have long honored our allegiance with the Grado Empire. And you invaded without warning. You ravaged our land. You killed my father... Even then, I told myself, I must not hate Grado or her people. If I gave in to my hate, the bond between our lands would be lost forever. I refused to hate. Instead, I lived for the day our nations would know peace again. But... If this is Grado’s true face... If you could extinguish Renais without pity, without remorse... If this is the case, then there is no room in my heart for forgiveness.

speaker: Novala
text: Impudent girl! Do you expect your words to save your countrymen? They will not. Your beloved people will all die, as will you.

speaker: Novala
text: Ha ha ha! If you must curse someone, curse your dear princess.

speaker: Girl
text: Help, someone!

speaker: Novala
text: Cry! Scream! HAHAHAHAHA!

speaker: Girl
text: Are we gonna get eaten?

speaker: Mother
text: We’re going to be fine. Someone will rescue us.

speaker: Boy
text: I heard there are monstrous spiders living in the mountains to the east. They’re said to be poisonous, so I stocked up on antitoxins… This antitoxin’s strong stuff. No need to worry about poison with this around. Hey! Why don’t you go ahead and take one. Go on, you may need it. They might still eat you, but at least they won’t be able to poison you!

speaker: Girl
text: Eeek! S-s-spider... Nooooo! Go away! Please, somebody, help! HEEEEELLLLPPP!

speaker: Girl
text: N-noooooo!

speaker: Girl
text: Eeek! S-s-spider... Nooooo! Go away! Please, somebody, help! HEEEEELLLLPPP!

speaker: Novala
text: No! It can’t be... They’ve made it this far?! Grrr... Must I do everything myself!?

speaker: Novala
text: Aah... Is this...the end? No fame? No...glory–

speaker: Eirika
text: You’re safe now.

speaker: Girl
text: Wa... Waaaaaaa! I was so scared... So very, very scared.

speaker: Mother
text: Thank you. You saved us both. If you would like, please take this... And thank you again.

speaker: Seth
text: Your late father, King Fado... He ordered to keep me silent until the proper time arrived. However, with all that has happened, with Emperor Vigarde’s actions... I feel it imperative that I tell you everything, Princess Eirika. Are you ready to hear the secret of the bracelet you wear?

speaker: Eirika
text: I am...

speaker: Seth
text: As you know, Princess... Renais houses one of the legendary Sacred Stones.

speaker: Eirika
text: Of course. It’s in the temple. It’s supposed to be a ward against evil.

speaker: Seth
text: Yes, the true stone is. But the stone in the temple is nothing but a forgery. The real Sacred Stone of Renais lies beneath the royal castle. Guarding it is a powerful seal, an infinitely complex lock of sorts.

speaker: Eirika
text: What? Is this true?

speaker: Seth
text: Yes. King Fado confided in me himself. The Sacred Stoned banished evil long ago and possess power beyond our ken. The ancient kings of Renais felt it prudent to seal ours away. They feared its power could be misused. They thought to remove the temptation. The keys to break the seal were hidden, too... Forged into bracelets... ...The very ones that you and your brother, Prince Ephraim, wear.

speaker: Eirika
text: Our bracelets? How could Father keep this a secret from me for so long?

speaker: Seth
text: They must know nothing of the bracelets. Tell them only if some great peril strikes.?These were King Fado’s exact orders. Prince Ephraim knows nothing of the bracelets?secret, either. The king told me this out of fear that something might happen to him. So that, when the time came, the two of you would learn the truth.

speaker: Eirika
text: The bracelets have such meaning...

speaker: Eirika
text: Yes. And we are the only living souls who know the secret of the Stone of Renais. At least, that’s what I was given to believe. And yet...

speaker: Eirika
text: Yet the Grado army has made it clear that they want me only for my bracelet.

speaker: Seth
text: Yes, quite clear at that... I don’t know how, but Emperor Vigarde must have learned the secret somehow. And now, his troops pursue the bracelet, and we are no closer to knowing his motives.

speaker: Eirika
text: He would use the bracelets to unlock the Sacred Stone and destroy it in secret...

speaker: Seth
text: Perhaps.

speaker: Eirika
text: Which means that my brother... and his bracelet...

speaker: Seth
text: If he’s been captured, they may have the bracelet already, and he may be–

speaker: Eirika
text: Ephraim...

speaker: Seth
text: Princess, we must take Novala’s words to be true. We must hurry to Prince Ephraim. The enemy soldiers who fled the battle will have reported our location by now. If the prince is being held prisoner at Renvall... I fear they might execute him once they learn of our approach.

speaker: Eirika
text: You’re right. We’ve no time to waste. We must hurry to Renvall! Let’s go rescue my brother!

speaker: Soldier
text: Princess Tana! Grado’s forces are approaching!

speaker: Tana
text: What? So soon? Ah, we’ve had no time!

speaker: Soldier
text: Milady, we lack the arms to defend this place. You must return to Castle Frelia.

speaker: Tana
text: I can’t! Not yet. We haven’t found Eirika and her companions yet. Eirika is my friend, and she needs my help. I won’t abandon her. Oh, I know! Go and ask Father– I mean King Hayden for more troops.

speaker: Soldier
text: Yes, Your Highness!

speaker: Tana
text: Eirika, please be safe.

speaker: Soldier
text: Commander Breguet, the enemy appears to be fortifying its position in the castle.

speaker: Breguet
text: Hmph. They’re tenacious, but they have no hope of stopping our advance.

speaker: Soldier
text: What are your orders, sir?

speaker: Breguet
text: Ha! Orders? You just stand here and watch. I’ll crush them myself!

speaker: Soldier
text: As you command, sir.

speaker: Breguet
text: Ha! That’s what happens when you face my lance!

speaker: Tana
text: St-stop right there! Call off your forces and turn back, or you’ll have me to deal with!

speaker: Breguet
text: Is that so? And who might you be?

speaker: Tana
text: Who–? I am Tana, Princess of Frelia. I will not permit you to abuse my country any longer.

speaker: Breguet
text: Frelia’s royal brat, huh? How convenient...

speaker: Tana
text: Leave this castle immediately. If you harm me, my father and brother will chase you to the earth’s end.

speaker: Breguet
text: Yes, I’ve heard of how King Hayden dotes on his precious little daughter. Let’s see how true that is. You’ll make us a fine hostage, my dear. Seize the girl and lock her up!

speaker: Soldier
text: Right away, sir!

speaker: Tana
text: No! Let me go!

speaker: Eirika
text: Seth, look...

speaker: Seth
text: I see it. It seems like Grado’s army has already reached Frelia. Princess, this place is perilous. We should bypass Mulan altogether and head straight to the castle.

speaker: Eirika
text: But we can’t just ignore this... You were there when Renais was invaded... You saw what I saw. You saw how the people suffered at the hands of Grado’s soldiers. Homes were destroyed, possessions stolen, women kidnapped... Anyone who resisted was executed without question, without hesitation.

speaker: Eirika
text: Please, Seth. I can’t allow that to happen here. I don’t want to see any more people harmed by Grado’s atrocities.

speaker: Seth
text: All right, Princess. I understand. Perhaps we can retake Mulan. But, Princess, you must act with caution. Your people need you, too.

speaker: Eirika
text: Of course, Seth. Come on! Let’s go!

speaker: Breguet
text: Hm? Is that the princess of Renais? Ha ha! It really is my lucky day! Fame and fortune ride to meet me! Move on, you slugs! Bring that girl to me!

speaker: Franz
text: Sir Gilliam, is that Mulan? Have we reached Frelia’s border already?

speaker: Gilliam
text: Aye, we have. Her Highness Princess Tana should be inside the castle.

speaker: Franz
text: But look — the countryside is crawling with Grado soldiers! Where’s the castle guard! Has Mulan fallen? Are we too late?

speaker: Gilliam
text: Too tough to say from here. Princess Tana’s in no danger if they want her as a bargaining tool. We men of the Eastern Watch will see her to safety.

speaker: Franz
text: Yes...Yes, of course. We mustn’t give up. We must move. We must retake the castle. Then, we ride forth to Princess Eirika’s aid.

speaker: Gilliam
text: I’ve stronger armor then you do. I’ll take the lead. Watch my back.

speaker: Franz
text: Princess Eirika, it is good to see you’re well.

speaker: Eirika
text: Franz, you made it through unscathed...

speaker: Franz
text: Y-yes, Your Highness! I met up with Sir Gilliam of Frelia and explained the situation in Renais. He told me that Princess Tana was in danger as well, here at Mulan. We rode as swiftly as we could.

speaker: Eirika
text: Tana is here? Franz, we must hurry!

speaker: Franz
text: Understood!

speaker: Seth
text: Is that you, Franz? I’m relieved to see you’re still in one piece!

speaker: Franz
text: Y-yes... and you as well, General. As long as you lead us, sir, the Knights of Renais cannot lose!

speaker: Seth
text: Franz, you and I must work together to protect Princess Eirika. I want you to ride with us.

speaker: Franz
text: Sir! With honor, sir!

speaker: Man
text: The rumors are true, aren’t they? The Grado army’s taken over the castle. It looks like they’ve seized the castle gate, too. Smart work–the gate provides defense and heals wounds to boot. They must be fierce warriors to have taken the gate. Watch yourself.

speaker: Man
text: That knight encamped at the castle was wearing the finest armor I’ve seen. It looked like it could turn aside almost any blade you swing at it. I know my armor, though. I wager a good rapier or armorslayer could get through it.

speaker: Breguet
text: Bah, what a worthless lot of curs I’ve been assigned!

speaker: Breguet
text: This...this can’t be... I...

speaker: Soldier
text: I’ve found them! Stragglers from Renais! Don’t let them get away!

speaker: Gilliam
text: Princess Tana.

speaker: Tana
text: Sir Gilliam... I’m sorry, I never meant to cause you such trouble.

speaker: Gilliam
text: It was no trouble. I live to serve, Princess.

speaker: Eirika
text: Tana!

speaker: Tana
text: ...Eirika?!? Is that really you?

speaker: Eirika
text: Tana, what are you doing, so far form Castle Frelia?

speaker: Tana
text: I heard that Renais had fallen, and I was so worried... But I’m glad to see that you’re safe... Wait! Where is Ephraim? Is he well?

speaker: Eirika
text: I wish I knew.

speaker: Tana
text: You haven’t heard from him? Oh, I hope he’s not been harmed... Come, we must go to Castle Frelia. My lord father may know something.

speaker: Eirika
text: Thank you, Tana.

speaker: Hayden
text: Oh, Tana... I’m grateful to see that you’re safe and home again! You’ve no idea how I worried when I heard you were under attack at Border Mulan. You are not to leave again without my permission. Do you understand?

speaker: Tana
text: Don’t be mad, Father. Look, I come bearing good news. Eirika! Come out now!

speaker: Eirika
text: King Hayden, I am please to see you again, even in these sad times.

speaker: Hayden
text: Ah, Eirika! It does my heart good to see you safe.

speaker: Eirika
text: Thank you. I was able to escape the castle before Renais fell. But I’m not sure if my father...

speaker: Hayden
text: Yes. I... have received word of your father.

speaker: Eirika
text: Your Highness? Please tell me. If my father well?

speaker: Hayden
text: ...My friend King Fado...did not survive the fall of Renais Castle.

speaker: Eirika
text: ...No, it cannot be...

speaker: Hayden
text: Rest assured, Grado will be punished for its cowardly act. This is Frelia’s promise. Eirika, please stay here and rest. I cannot imagine how exhausted you must be.

speaker: Seth
text: King Hayden. You know of Prince Ephraim’s disappearance, do you not?

speaker: Hayden
text: Yes, we hear the prince and his men hound Grado at every turn. It’s said that he’s led his forces into the empire itself. Reports suggest he’s crossed the border and now fights in Renvall.

speaker: Eirika
text: My brother... He fights on? Even now?

speaker: Hayden
text: Yes. My pegasus knights bought this information at a great price. Even though Renais has fallen, he charges into the enemy’s heart. He is truly Fado’s son... What a valiant youth. I wish I knew whether he remains unharmed, but I do not.

speaker: Eirika
text: King Hayden, I thank you for your offer, but I cannot stay. I intend to ride to my brother’s side with reinforcements.

speaker: Hayden
text: I cannot allow it. I know how you feel, but this plan is suicide. I would be betraying Fado’s memory if I allowed any harm to befall you. Stay here. Rest and mourn. Leave this war to the warriors.

speaker: Eirika
text: I know you mean well, Your Majesty. However, I have lost my father, and my twin brother is in peril. My brother, he is a part of me... I cannot rest here in peace while he risks his life.

speaker: Hayden
text: No. Renais has no more army. Grado’s forces decimated it. I wish Frelia could provide you with support, with soldiers, but... My son, Innes, is on his way to meet the empire’s forces. We cannot spare a single brigade. Your own retinue of knights cannot possibly face Grado alone. Are you so determined to go?

speaker: Eirika
text: Yes. ...With apologies.

speaker: Hayden
text: ...As resolute as your father, eh? What am I to do in the face of such foolhardy determination? Vanessa.

speaker: Vanessa
text: Here, Your Highness!

speaker: Hayden
text: Moulder.

speaker: Moulder
text: You called, my king?

speaker: Hayden
text: Gilliam.

speaker: Gilliam
text: Yes, sire?

speaker: Hayden
text: You are to accompany Princess Eirika of Renais into Grado territory. I expect each of you to provide aid and support for her brother.

speaker: Gilliam
text: Hmm. Quite a grave responsibility you’ve given us.

speaker: Vanessa
text: No matter the obstacles, we will perform our duty.

speaker: Gilliam
text: Our lives are yours.

speaker: Hayden
text: These are some of my most trusted and stalwart vassals. They will, no doubt, prove themselves quite valuable on your journey. Remember, you are venturing behind enemy lines. You will need supplies. I will have a supply convoy readied to carry your weapons and provisions. It will remain at your side, no matter how far afield you venture.

speaker: Eirika
text: King Hayden, I... Thank you.

speaker: Hayden
text: No, save your thanks for your return... with your brother, Prince Ephraim.

speaker: Eirika
text: Yes, Your highness!

speaker: Tana
text: Eirika, you don’t really intend to go through with this, do you? I can’t guess how you must feel, but its’ just too dangerous. What would happen if you were captured by Grado’s men?

speaker: Eirika
text: Thank you for your concern, Tana. But I have no choice. Don’t you see, Tana? I have to go.

speaker: Tana
text: Eirika... Oh, why is this happening? What’s gone wrong with the world?

speaker: Eirika
text: Tana...

speaker: Tana
text: Why would Grado invade? Emperor Vigarde is a man of peace. His people adore him. And you and Ephraim are friends with Prince Lyon, are you not? What could be behind this madness? Why is this happening...

speaker: Eirika
text: I have no answers for you, Tana. I don’t want to believe it, but the reality is that we are at war. If I do nothing, I may lose my brother as well as my father. This is why I have to fight. It’s the only answer I have.

speaker: Ewan
text: We’re almost there! Come on! My teacher lives just up ahead.

speaker: Eirika
text: Slow down, Ewan. Let’s stick together.

speaker: Innes
text: ...This fog’s getting thick. I don’t expect any more surprise attacks, but that doesn’t mean we–

speaker: Ewan
text: Quick worrying, mister! You’re gonna get left behind.

speaker: Innes
text: ...Don’t speak to me, boy. I don’t tolerate insolence.

speaker: Eirika
text: Innes, he’s only a child. There’s no reason to be so rude. He is helping us after all.

speaker: Ewan
text: That’s right. Without me, you’d never get where you’re going. So come on already!

speaker: Innes
text: Stop. Don’t take another step.

speaker: Ewan
text: Huh? That’s gonna make it awfully hard to get where we need to go.

speaker: Innes
text: ...What do you know about that fort? It looks like it’s been abandoned for some time. Is anyone using it?

speaker: Ewan
text: Nope. It’s really run-down. Nobody ever goes there. It’s been empty for ages. I’ve been inside, so I know.

speaker: Innes
text: Is that right? Then what’s that sound, and where is it coming from?

speaker: Ewan
text: Huh? What sound? Hey, you’re right... I do hear a weird noise. You could hear that? Neat! You’ve got really good hearing. I wonder what it is...

speaker: Eirika
text: There it is again. Prince, is this...

speaker: Innes
text: Eirika.

speaker: Eirika
text: Yes?

speaker: Innes
text: Get your troops ready. Tell them to prepare for battle... We’ve been spotted. Monsters are coming.

speaker: Tethys
text: Ewan, it’s dangerous here. Get behind me.

speaker: Ewan
text: No way. I’m gonna fight too.

speaker: Tethys
text: No. You’re too young. You’re not ready for this. Are you going to do as I say or not? I don’t know what I would do if you were to get injured.

speaker: Ewan
text: Oh...OK.

speaker: L’Arachel
text: What spacious chambers. Hm... A bit musty, but I like it. I’ve decided. We’ll bed here for the night. I do wonder where Rennac disappeared to, though. I told him not to wander off, but...

speaker: Dozla
text: Hmph! Lady L’Arachel, this could be trouble.

speaker: L’Arachel
text: What is it, Dozla?

speaker: Dozla
text: Look there! Through that break in the fog... Looks like we’ve got some nasty creatures running ’bout this place.

speaker: L’Arachel
text: ...I can’t see a thing. But this can be nothing but good fortune shining down on us again. Losing our way in the mountains and running into these abominations? There can be no doubt: we were brought here to destroy these foul things! Come, Dozla! We fight!

speaker: Dozla
text: Gwah ha ha! My heart cries out for battle!

speaker: Eirika
text: You... L’Arachel!

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Hello! So it’s true! Blessings do come in threes!

speaker: Eirika
text: L’Arachel, this place is dangerous. You should find safe haven elsewhere.

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Oh, you needn’t worry about us. As you well know, my divine mission is to purge the land of these obscenities. I will show you the splendor that is L’Arachel in action! Bear witness!

speaker: Eirika
text: If you insist. At least let us join forces for the time being.

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Dozla.

speaker: Dozla
text: Gwah ha ha! What is it, Lady L’Arachel?

speaker: L’Arachel
text: We’re going to join these good people and eradicate these unclean monstrosities.

speaker: Dozla
text: Sounds fun! What would you have me to do?

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Oh, just carry on in your normal manner: destroy, destroy, destroy. But do be sure to enjoy yourself.

speaker: Dozla
text: Gwah ha ha! I am your obedient servant!

speaker: Eirika
text: Thank you, L’Arachel.

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Please, speak nothing of it. It is heaven’s dictate that I come here to cleanse this charming place of monsters. What’s important is– Oh my! I just realized I have not yet had the honor of your name.

speaker: Eirika
text: Oh, you’re right. How strange... We’ve met so often now that I had assumed you already... Please forgive my lack of manners. My name is Eirika.

speaker: Seth
text: Milady...

speaker: Eirika
text: It’s all right, Seth. She’s clearly not our enemy.

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Eirika... Aha! So you must be Princess Eirika of Renais! It is simply an honor to meet you. And how strange that we should meet again in this place. You must be lost as well. This continent is so confusing.

speaker: Eirika
text: Um, yes. Actually, we’re not lost at all. You see...

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Is that so! Well, clearly, I must be allowed to accompany you.

speaker: Eirika
text: You want to travel with us? I appreciate your offer, but our journey is far too perilous. I do not wish to pull you into this madness.

speaker: L’Arachel
text: No, no, no. There can be no doubt that we were sent here to aid you. It is all part of the grand design. I, L’Arachel, shall play my role and fulfill my divine duties. This I swear!

speaker: Seth
text: Are you sure this is wise, Princess?

speaker: Eirika
text: Don’t worry, Seth.

speaker: L’Arachel
text: ...Well, that’s that, Dozla. You and I are now traveling with Eirika and her companions.

speaker: Dozla
text: Gwah ha ha! I understand. For you, Lady L’Arachel, I would do absolutely anything! I would run to the ends of this world and dive into a sea of evil!

speaker: L’Arachel
text: How very like you, my dear, dedicated Dozla! So noble! Come! We’re off!

speaker: Dozla
text: Gwah ha ha!

speaker: Ewan
text: Teeeaaaacher... Hellooooooo... That’s strange. He’s not here. Must be out wandering again.

speaker: Eirika
text: He’s out? That poses a problem. Do you know when he’ll return?

speaker: Ewan
text: Hmmm... I don’t know. He often goes out and looks for people in need.

speaker: Saleh
text: ...I believe I told you it would be best to stay away.

speaker: Saleh
text: I’ve been charged with a mission and must depart again soon.

speaker: Ewan
text: Ah! Teacher!

speaker: Eirika
text: Y-you... We’ve met before, haven’t we? You were looking for someone...

speaker: Saleh
text: ...Oh, yes. And now we meet again.

speaker: Ewan
text: These people say they want to go through Caer Pelyn. I could guide them myself, but I thought it might be better if you went, too. That’s why I brought them here. What do you say? Will you guide them?

speaker: Eirika
text: Would you, please?

speaker: Saleh
text: ...Very well. I’m heading there now. If you need to go to Caer Pelyn, you’re free to follow me.

speaker: Eirika
text: You don’t mind?

speaker: Saleh
text: We have little interest in the outside world, but we do not refuse travelers. I should warn you: the road is not easy, and you look very weary. You should rest a night before attempting the mountains.

speaker: Innes
text: We do need rest, it’s true. We are all exhausted from our encounter with those creatures. We must give our men time to heal, or they’ll be useless in an emergency.

speaker: Ewan
text: It’s settled then. I’ll go on ahead and let the elder know we’re coming. See? Even when there’s no fighting to be done, I’m still useful!

speaker: Eirika
text: No, wait! ...He’s gone. I wonder if he’ll be all right.

speaker: Innes
text: Idiotic boy. I understand his need to be helpful, but...

speaker: Saleh
text: Ewan knows this land well. You needn’t worry about him. We’ll depart at sunrise. I suggest you all get some rest.

speaker: Glen
text: Princess Eirika of Renais. Hold.

speaker: Eirika
text: Who? You.. You’re General Glen of Grado. We met once in the capital, didn’t we? You were very kind to me. However, if you’re here now, I have to assume this means...

speaker: Glen
text: Yes, it does. I wish our reunion could come under different circumstances. Eirika, I must tell you, I come here on the direct orders of the emperor. I’m to bring to justice the rebel army leader who’s been terrorizing Carcino. It’s you, Eirika. They say you’ve been murdering innocents.

speaker: Eirika
text: What? Wait! What do you mean? I...

speaker: Glen
text: ...If you have something to say, I would hear it. I know all too well that Grado has robbed you of your homeland, but even so... I do not believe revenge could drive a woman like you to such depths. And yet... here you are in Carcino with a small army under your command. And the emperor tells us that you massacred everyone in Port Kiris.

speaker: Eirika
text: That... That’s a lie! I could never...

speaker: Glen
text: Go on.

speaker: Innes
text: ...This is ridiculous. Believe what you want. Could one of the legendary Imperial Three honestly be as stupid as this?

speaker: Glen
text: ...What do you mean?

speaker: Innes
text: Carcino betrayed Frelia and set a pack of mercenary dogs to kill me. And you paint Eirika a rebel instigator? It’s an absurd farce. Your emperor commits horrors, and you believe Eirika is a criminal?

speaker: Glen
text: ...What are you saying?

speaker: Innes
text: You truly are blind, aren’t you? You’re one of the Imperial Three, and yet you can’t see your emperor’s plan?

speaker: Eirika
text: That’s enough, Innes. There’s no need to provoke him. General Glen, we’ve told you what we know to be true, what we’ve seen firsthand. We don’t want to fight you... But if you push us, we will drive you back to Grado with your tail between your legs.

speaker: Glen
text: ...I see. You...are more observant than you know. I am ignorant of the emperor’s designs. General Duessel and I both questioned the wisdom of this war. And if you really are innocent of the crimes attributed to you... Why would His Majesty lie to us? I must know the answer.

speaker: Eirika
text: So, you...believe us?

speaker: Glen
text: The Princess Eirika I met long ago was kind and merciful in spirit. You’ve faced relentless hardship, and yet that selfsame spirit remains true. ...Let’s put our fight aside for now. I will learn the truth. Then I will once again perform the duties of my office. If you have lied to me today, I will hound you to the very grave itself.

speaker: Eirika
text: Very well...

speaker: Valter
text: Glen. Where do you think you’re going?

speaker: Glen
text: Valter...

speaker: Valter
text: Tsk, tsk. What am I to make of this? Those little birds I saw flitting away into the mountains looked vaguely familiar. What do you suppose would happen if it were known you let Eirika escape?

speaker: Glen
text: Do as you will. I’m returning to the capital. I have questions for the emperor. Clear the path, Valter.

speaker: Valter
text: Hold on now. No reason to rush off, is there? After all, this is where you’re going to die. See?

speaker: Glen
text: ...What are you babbling about?

speaker: Valter
text: Heh heh... We were a grand trio–the Imperial Three: You, Duessel, and me. But my place among you was stolen, and I was exiled from Grado.

speaker: Glen
text: You slaughtered people who had no intention of fighting. The emperor’s punishment was just and warranted.

speaker: Valter
text: Heh heh...heh heh heh... After my fall from glory, only desire kept me alive. Desire for revenge. My hatred burned so fierce that I was only barely able to keep my sanity. That hatred keeps me warm still today. Oh, how it burns...

speaker: Valter
text: Hear me, Glen, wyvern general of the Imperial Three. I live for battle. I crave it. I have no need for peace. That is why you must die.

speaker: Glen
text: Cur! You’re mad!

speaker: Valter
text: A battle between generals... Sends the spirit soaring, eh? Come, Glen! Entertain me! Ha ha ha ha ha ha!

speaker: Glen
text: Urrgh...

speaker: Valter
text: Go. The small fish are yours.

speaker: Valter
text: Heh heh... This is merely the beginning. Endless battle, war without end... Heh heh... ha hahahahahaha!

speaker: Seth
text: The local villagers tell me that Bazba’s Bandits keep their lair nearby. A few of them saw a lad matching the description of our bracelet thief. It seems a fair guess that the youth is one of these bandits.

speaker: Eirika
text: Bandits...Here in Renais, our homeland. I had no idea... Burning out villages...Stealing from out people with no fear of reprisal?

speaker: Seth
text: It wasn’t always like this. The knights used to protect the citizenry... However, with Renais in ruins and her army tattered, law and order are hard to find. It doesn’t look like the Grado army is interested in maintaining order here. If nothing changes, Renais will continue this sad plunge into savagery.

speaker: Neimi
text: Uh...Hello?

speaker: Neimi
text: Pardon me for asking... but are you all some sort of...mercenary troop?

speaker: Eirika
text: Why do you ask?

speaker: Neimi
text: P-p-please, you have to help Colm. You have to! I told him it was too dangerous, but he wouldn’t listen to me!

speaker: Eirika
text: Please, you must calm yourself. Start at the beginning, and speak slowly.

speaker: Neimi
text: All right...Sniff. I’m Neimi. I’m from... I used to be from a village named Lark... Except the village is gone.

speaker: Eirika
text: Gone? What do you mean?

speaker: Neimi
text: Bazba’s Bandits burned it down. Only Colm and I escaped. The other villagers... The bandits attacked them and...

speaker: Seth
text: Neimi, what are you doing here?

speaker: Neimi
text: Bazba’s Bandits... They have a hideout here in these mountains. That’s where Colm... Um, Colm’s my...uh...We’ve known each other since we were kids. He went to steal back something the bandits took from me...

speaker: Eirika
text: He went alone? That’s a very dangerous thing...

speaker: Neimi
text: Yes, I know. Th-that’s what I told him, but he wouldn’t listen to me. If I lose Colm, too, I don’t know... I...I’ll... sniff...

speaker: Eirika
text: Wait, please don’t cry. Don’t worry. We’ll find your friend and see that he’s not harmed.

speaker: Neimi
text: Really? Really and truly? Oh, thank you! Thank you!!! I... I don’t have much money, but.. I’ll do anything to help.

speaker: Seth
text: Your Highness? What will it be?

speaker: Eirika
text: If the thief we’re after has gone to the bandits?lair as well... Well, it seems as though we share a common cause with Neimi. She is a citizen of Renais, after all. And isn’t it our duty to defend our countrymen? I’m only sad that we weren’t here to protect her friends and neighbors... So, yes, I feel we must help her.

speaker: Seth
text: Very well. Neimi, I trust you can lead the way?

speaker: Neimi
text: Er, yes... It’s this way.

speaker: Neimi
text: Um... Is there anything I can do to help? I feel so... When I was little I used to go hunting with my grandfather. What I mean is I can– I’m not bad with a bow.

speaker: Seth
text: Really?

speaker: Neimi
text: Uh-huh.

speaker: Seth
text: I see. You should remain behind and protect Princess Eirika.

speaker: Bazba
text: Hm. Not sure who’s out there, but it looks like we’ve got guests. Let’s give ’em a warm welcome, lads. You see a stranger, stick an axe in him!

speaker: Colm
text: And here we go! Ha! And not a soul saw me. These bandits are easy picking. I guess I might as well start with these chests here.

speaker: Neimi
text: C-Colm...

speaker: Colm
text: Neimi?! What are you doing here? I told you to wait for me, didn’t I?

speaker: Neimi
text: I couldn’t... It’s too dangerous. C’mon, let’s go home.

speaker: Colm
text: We don’t have a home! Don’t you get it? Look, just leave everything to me. I can take care of it in a flash, but I don’t need a clumsy oaf like you tagging along.

speaker: Neimi
text: But...but...

speaker: Colm
text: Oh, this is ridiculous. We’ll talk later. Don’t leave my side, Neimi.

speaker: Neimi
text: I–All right.

speaker: Bazba
text: I’m the head of this bandit pack, the mighty Bazba! Hope you’ve enjoyed your life, ‘cuz it’s about to end!

speaker: Bazba
text: I’m the...mighty...Bazba... This...ain’t–

speaker: Neimi
text: C-Colm...

speaker: Colm
text: What now? I told you not to worry. I could’ve robbed these bandits blind on my own, thank you very much.

speaker: Neimi
text: I was... worried...

speaker: Colm
text: H-Hold on! I’m sorry! C’mon! Don’t start bawling!

speaker: Neimi
text: Aaah...sniff... No more...dangerous stuff... by yourself...

speaker: Colm
text: Fine, fine. I promise. But you have to stop crying all the time. All right?

speaker: Neimi
text: Uh-huh...

speaker: Colm
text: Oh, yeah. Take a look at this.

speaker: Neimi
text: Hm?

speaker: Colm
text: I got your mirror back. Remember how you cried when we left Lark? You thought you’d lost this. I knew it was your mother’s, and I knew those thugs had taken it. So I went and got it back! See what happens when you give me a job? Guaranteed results!

speaker: Neimi
text: Colm... Aa...Waaah... Colm...

speaker: Colm
text: Hey Wh-why are you crying this time? C’mon! Stop! Knock it off! Please, Neimi...

speaker: Seth
text: ...This is quite touching, but... I think you’d best return Princess Eirika’s bracelet to her now.

speaker: Colm
text: Wh-what are you talking about? Are you trying to say that I–

speaker: Colm
text: Whoa! Whoa there! Hold it! It’s right here! Take it!

speaker: Seth
text: ...... Tell me, boy, is this the path you’ve chosen for your life? If this girl matters to you, you must quit this dark road.

speaker: Colm
text: Uh, yeah...Right.

speaker: Seth
text: We’re leaving. Do not expect to be rescued again. Farewell.

speaker: Colm
text: ...Hey, wait! Let us go with you. You can’t just leave us here.

speaker: Seth
text: Pardon?

speaker: Colm
text: Neimi and I... We’ve got no home to return to. No matter where we go, there’s just gonna be more fighting. You’re mercenaries, right? Well, then take us with you. I’m a handy guy to have around. I know I can help you out.

speaker: Seth
text: I would prefer not, but I’ll agree with Eirika’s decision. Our duty is a grave one however. We’ve no time to waste shepherding you.

speaker: Colm
text: That’s fine with us You just wait– I promise you won’t regret your decision.

speaker: Seth
text: I retrieved your bracelet from the bandit’s stronghold. Here you are, Princess.

speaker: Eirika
text: Thank you, Seth. You know...Father gave me this bracelet when I was a child. It has only one match in the world, and my brother wears it.

speaker: Seth
text: Lady Eirika, you must take care never to lose that bracelet. It is the proof that King Fado entrusted the future of Renais to you, his children.

speaker: Eirika
text: Seth...What is it you’re not telling me?

speaker: Seth
text: ...I apologize, Your Highness. When the times comes, I will tell you what I know. Until then, I...

speaker: Eirika
text: I see. If you tell me it must wait, then it can wait. I trust you.

speaker: Seth
text: Then we should get moving again. We’re safe from bandits for now, but I can’t guarantee for how long.

speaker: Eirika
text: This... This is just the beginning, isn’t it? If we hope to free out homeland, it will take battle after battle...

speaker: Seth
text: I’m afraid so, Your Highness. The day you and Prince Ephraim win back the freedom and honor of Renais will come. But I fear it lies at the end of a long and treacherous road.

speaker: Eirika
text: I know. I must fight for that day. In the names of all those I could not save, I’ll lead us home. Let’s go. My brother awaits!

speaker: Selena
text: General Duessel.

speaker: Duessel
text: Selena. Have you been back long? Tell me, how fares the campaign in Renais?

speaker: Selena
text: Signs of chaos abound. Brigands ride without fear, and the peasant’s cries fill the air.

speaker: Duessel
text: Hmm... If Grado’s troops do not enforce public order, the situation will only worsen. And still, His Majesty has given us no orders. Perhaps, just this once, I should take the lead...

speaker: Glen
text: What could His Majesty be thinking? Breaking our long-held alliance with Renais–invading without warning... He’s never been this way before. He abhors violence.

speaker: Glen
text: And have you noticed the recent promotions? Who are they are going to? Certainly not to the soldiers who have Grado’s best interests at heart. I feel this invasion is the prelude to a much larger war. I feel as though His Majesty is no longer the man we knew him to be.

speaker: Selena
text: Glen, it doesn’t matter what any of us might think of our orders. We are his servants, and we will not question His Majesty’s intentions.

speaker: Glen
text: I know that, Selena. And yet...

speaker: Duessel
text: That’s enough. Both of you. His Majesty summons us. Let’s hope we can learn a little during our audience.

speaker: Vigarde
text: ...I appreciate your work in fulfilling your previous orders. You are the hammers that drive the nails of the empire’s will... You will continue to operate ...without hesitation... wherever I send you.

speaker: Duessel
text: By your command.

speaker: Selena
text: In Your Majesty’s name.

speaker: Glen
text: Yes, sire...

speaker: Vigarde
text: ...However, I know this... You, my Imperial Three, lack the strength to conquer the remaining nations alone. In the invasion of Renais, certain soldiers performed beyond expectation. I have chosen them to join you as new generals in the empire’s service. ...Come.

speaker: Vigarde
text: ...The performance of these men surpassed even your own. With the addition of these three... The empire will have six generals strong enough to conquer this land. Do you understand?

speaker: Riev
text: Heh heh heh... I am Riev, given the name Blood Beryl by His Majesty. I know I am a newcomer, but I pray for your favor.

speaker: Duessel
text: ...Understood.

speaker: Caellach
text: I’m Caellach. I was a mercenary, fighting in the desert. Seems I’m to be called Tiger Eye... You’re a fine lookin’ lass, aren’t you? Yeah, I’m gonna love working with you.

speaker: Valter
text: So we meet again. You know me as General Valter, but you will call me the Moonstone. I’ll save you worthless dogs from your own incompetence. You’ll thank me later.

speaker: Glen
text: Valter... You scum!

speaker: Duessel
text: Peace, Glen.

speaker: Vigarde
text: Selena. Caellach. You will bring me Frelia.

speaker: Selena
text: Yes, sire.

speaker: Caellach
text: Sure. Good as done.

speaker: Vigarde
text: Riev. Duessel. You are charged with the defense of the empire. ...I will speak to you individually with more details later.

speaker: Riev
text: Heh heh heh... Understood, Your Majesty.

speaker: Duessel
text: By your command, sire.

speaker: Valter
text: And me?

speaker: Vigarde
text: Valter, Glen... I have other duties for you...

speaker: Glen
text: Yes, Your Majesty?

speaker: Vigarde
text: Renais has fallen, but Princess Eirika still eludes us... Her brother, Prince Ephraim, leads a resistance within our borders. Bring the siblings to me.

speaker: Valter
text: Ha ha.. Of course.

speaker: Lyon
text: ...I yield. The point is yours, Eirika. You’re swift, aren’t you? Compared to you, I’m– I’ve been bested at fencing by a woman. Pitiful crown prince, am I not?

speaker: Eirika
text: That’s not true...

speaker: Lyon
text: Oh, no, Eirika. It is. The people need a strong ruler. They don’t want a weakling like me. They want the strength you and Ephraim share. My body is frail. I prefer to spend my time locked away in the castle, reading... I think my father would be better served if someone else took my place. I’m sure all of our retainers feel the same...

speaker: Eirika
text: You’re wrong, Lyon. An emperor without compassion will never hold the people’s love. And one day, your compassion will surely save us all. I believe that.

speaker: Lyon
text: Eirika... Thank you. Yes. I...I will do my best. Even though I lack your strength, there must be some good I can do.

speaker: Eirika
text: There is.

speaker: Lyon
text: By the way, Eirika... If it please you, would you accept this?

speaker: Seth
text: Princess Eirika? Is there something wrong?

speaker: Eirika
text: N-no. It’s nothing.

speaker: Seth
text: Jehanna Hall has been completely occupied by Grado soldiers. I’m sorry to report that Queen Ismaire is already...

speaker: Innes
text: And the one giving orders to the troops in the palace is Crown Prince Lyon?

speaker: L’Arachel
text: What is there to give us pause? Should we not storm the palace and retake it by strength of arms?

speaker: Innes
text: Frelia’s spy network reports that Prince Lyon is an initiate of dark magic. If this is true, even approaching him will be a serious challenge. I’d heard the prince dislikes violence. However, it could all have been a ruse.

speaker: Innes
text: Still, if we don’t retake the palace, we’ve no hope of defeating Grado. We must rescue the queen, no matter the cost...

speaker: Eirika
text: I understand. Let’s go!

speaker: Carlyle
text: Queen Ismaire... Please do not resist. I have no desire to see you harmed.

speaker: Ismaire
text: Carlyle... Why have you betrayed us? After all these years of loyal service as Jehanna’s most decorated commander... Without you, I could not have ruled these long years since my husband’s passing. It was through your unwavering support alone that I still sit upon the throne. You are the cornerstone of Jehanna. You have held my trust more than any man. So tell me why. Why have you betrayed us? Why have you betrayed me?

speaker: Carlyle
text: Your Highness–No... My queen... Ismaire... It is your own fault. You are too lovely, my queen.

speaker: Ismaire
text: Carlyle...

speaker: Carlyle
text: The first time I met you, twenty years ago now... I saw you in the garden of this very palace... and I was bewitched. Your pale beauty far surpassed that of any flower. I was in the grips of an unforgivable desire. You were the wife of my king, to whom I’d sworn life and loyalty. I told myself a grand lie that day. I told myself I could be happy simply serving you as your most loyal knight.

speaker: Carlyle
text: After years of duty, years of service, years of...of silence... I became aware once more of the feelings I’d buried deep within myself. How could I leave this world without expressing my true desires? Could anything be more desolate? More devoid of meaning? That is when I made my decision. I would follow my heart and claim your hand as my own.

speaker: Ismaire
text: Carlyle... You forget yourself. You ruin our country and kill our countrymen. Did you think I would be pleased? Did you think I would love you for this?

speaker: Carlyle
text: I need no country. I care nothing for my countrymen. I can see nothing but you. If you would only be mine...

speaker: Ismaire
text: Carlyle...

speaker: Soldier
text: To arms, mercenaries. We’re under attack! You there! Ready your weapons!

speaker: Rennac
text: What?!? No, no, no. That was never part of the deal. The only fight I’m here for is with the locks of the treasure chamber.

speaker: Soldier
text: Hah... Don’t get so excited. I doubt you mercenaries will see any action at all once we soldiers’ve finished.

speaker: Rennac
text: Yeah, great. You go do that. Whew... With all these soldiers around, I shouldn’t have to lift a finger. I’ll just sit here and wait for them to win they day. Then, I collect my pay! No more being ordered around by that selfish princess and her moronic bodyguard. This is the life. Lady Luck loves me. But something doesn’t feel right...

speaker: Caellach
text: Hey, Carlyle! Impressive work you’ve done here. My compliments.

speaker: Carlyle
text: ...I gave you everything I promised. I opened the hall to your forces.

speaker: Caellach
text: Yes. The palace is mine. My palace... Oh, how I do like the sound of that.

speaker: Carlyle
text: Do whatever you want with the royal treasury. The only treasure I wish to leave here with is the queen of my heart.

speaker: Caellach
text: Oh, yeah, about your queen?.. There’s been a change of plans.

speaker: Ismaire
text: Ah!

speaker: Caellach
text: Don’t move, Carlyle. You twitch, and the queen dies.

speaker: Carlyle
text: Blackheart! What is the meaning of this?

speaker: Caellach
text: Calm down. You’ll get her back as soon as I’m done with her. Jehanna’s Sacred Stone is around here somewhere. I’ve got to find it and destroy it. I need this woman to guide me to its hiding place.

speaker: Carlyle
text: Do not lay a hand on my queen!

speaker: Carlyle
text: Don’t get so incensed. I’m not going to harm her. I’m not like that freak Valter. I’m kind to women. But if you make a wrong move, you’ll lose your prize. Understood?

speaker: Carlyle
text: Yes...

speaker: Caellach
text: There are some annoying pests outside who think to win back the hall. I want you to take care of them. Lose, and the queen will never be yours.

speaker: Carlyle
text: ...... If my queen comes to any harm in your care...

speaker: Caellach
text: Yes, of course. I know all about the might of your sword arm. As long as the Sacred Stone is destroyed, you’ll get all you ask for.

speaker: Caellach
text: Greetings, Prince. Let’s get going.

speaker: Lyon
text: Caellach... You will put an end to this. Destroying the Sacred Stones is... Ugh...ack...

speaker: Caellach
text: What’s this? Are you still ill? You know, you’re not very princely. C’mon. Follow me.

speaker: Lyon
text: Caellach...

speaker: Rennac
text: Hey, that’s a comely lass. Think I’ll have a few words... Wait. Er, haven’t I met you before?

speaker: Eirika
text: You... You were traveling with L’Arachel before, weren’t you?

speaker: Rennac
text: Oh, yeah... Renais... I’ve got to get–

speaker: Eirika
text: L’Arachel is traveling with us. Should I let her know you’re here?

speaker: Rennac
text: Uh, no! Wait a moment! You... You don’t have to bother her. Actually I wanted to ask you something. How would you like to hire me? The name’s Rennac. I’m a world-class thief, and proud of it. A man of many talents. Lockpicks are for amateurs. I can pick chests and doors with my bare hands. And I’m better with a blade than most swordsmen.

speaker: Eirika
text: Uh...

speaker: Rennac
text: I’m a useful fellow to have around. And cheap, too! Only 9,980 gold! Well, what do you think?

speaker: Eirika
text: Fine. I’ll pay the 9,980 gold.

speaker: Rennac
text: Very good! You know a bargain when you see one, don’t you? Not at all like a certain pious princess I know.

speaker: Eirika
text: Were you speaking of L’Arachel?

speaker: Rennac
text: Uh, no... Idle chitchat about that lass is bound to land me in hot water. Right, then! You’re my new boss. Point out any doors or chests, and get out of my way!

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Aha! So this is where you’ve wandered off to, Rennac!

speaker: Rennac
text: Princess L’Arachel? Uh-oh, um...

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Come with me.

speaker: Rennac
text: Wait... hold on now. Go with you where? Look, sorry, but I’ve been hired by the Grado Empire, and... Hello! I’m talking to you!

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Rennac, whatever is the matter? I promise to listen to your story later, but now, we must be going!

speaker: Rennac
text: No, I’m no servant, like that kook Dozla. I’m a mercenary. I escorted you to Renais like I was hired to do, didn’t I? You have no right to drag me across creation without any pay whatsoever!

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Is this about wages? I believe you’ve received ample compensation.

speaker: Rennac
text: Ample?! Do you even know what that word means? You’ve the princess of Rausten! I thought working for you would pay well. Yet your purse strings are knotted tight, and I’ve almost been killed so many–

speaker: L’Arachel
text: The joy that comes from doing good is not something that can be purchased. There. All better? Let’s go.

speaker: Rennac
text: NO! I said I don’t want to! Riding with you is– ...And there she goes. Oh...By the Stones, why did I ever take that job in the first place?

speaker: L’Arachel
text: We must hurry, Rennac.

speaker: Rennac
text: Right, right. I’m coming...

speaker: Carlyle
text: I...I just wanted the two of us...

speaker: Carlyle
text: Queen Ismaire. I’m–

speaker: Caellach
text: This is as good a place as any. All right, Your Majesty. Hand over the Sacred Stone.

speaker: Ismaire
text: ...I know nothing of the Sacred Stone’s keeping place.

speaker: Caellach
text: Don’t waste me time. My partner here sees everything. When the rebellion began, you went straight to the palace altar. You had hoped to prevent us from smashing the Sacred Stone. But you have the Stone of Jehanna with you right now, don’t you?

speaker: Caellach
text: Hand it over. Cooperate, and I’ll let you live.

speaker: Ismaire
text: ...I cannot.

speaker: Caellach
text: Oh, give it up, will you? I’ve no time for games. If you resist, I’ll just kill you and take it anyway.

speaker: Lyon
text: H-hold! You mustn’t harm her, Caellach...

speaker: Caellach
text: Shut up, Prince. My orders come from higher than you. You’ve not going to start disobeying his word, are you?

speaker: Caellach
text: Last chance. Give me your Sacred Stone.

speaker: Ismaire
text: ...I cannot.

speaker: Caellach
text: Ha ha! A queen to the end. I like you. You’ve got guts. Good-bye.

speaker: Lyon
text: Ah!

speaker: Caellach
text: And here’s the Sacred Stone. That makes two for me. I’m on a roll now.

speaker: Caellach
text: And another Sacred Stone has been destroyed. Grado, Frelia, and now Jehanna... Only two stones remain.

speaker: Ismaire
text: Uuh...ahh...

speaker: Lyon
text: Ah... What should I do? C-Caellach... You must help her.

speaker: Caellach
text: Leave her. Let her last breath be a harsh and ragged rasp. She’s not long for this world. Why, if you really wanted to help her, you’d deliver the final blow yourself!

speaker: Lyon
text: N-no. I couldn’t.

speaker: Caellach
text: ...What a joke. I have a little work to wrap up in the hall before we leave. You should hit the road pretty soon, too, Prince.

speaker: Eirika
text: I wonder where Queen Ismaire is.

speaker: Innes
text: I heard she was in the throne room, but there’s no sight of her. And there’s no Sacred Stone, either.

speaker: L’Arachel
text: We must search quickly.

speaker: Lyon
text: Ah...

speaker: Eirika
text: Lyon!

speaker: Lyon
text: Eirika...

speaker: Eirika
text: Wait, Lyon! Don’t run away! My brother and I have been so worried about you... We know more then anyone the gentleness of your spirit. Your father is deranged, isn’t he? That’s why Grado invaded Renais, right? Tell me, Lyon... Please... Tell me what has happened.

speaker: Lyon
text: I’m sorry, Eirika. I’ve wanted to see you and Ephraim for so long now... I wanted to see you so that I could apologize. The invasion of Renais... I couldn’t stop it. I’m sorry, but I still cannot talk to you. Not yet...

speaker: Eirika
text: You... You have a reason, don’t you?

speaker: Lyon
text: Mm... I can’t talk about it now, but... I promise I will tell you everything someday.

speaker: Eirika
text: I see... I believe you, Lyon. I must tell you, I’m a little relieved. I was afraid you’d changed as much as your poor father has. I’m so glad.

speaker: Lyon
text: Me, too, Eirika... No, you have changed. You’re even more beautiful than you were before.

speaker: Eirika
text: L-Lyon...

speaker: Lyon
text: I’m sorry, I have to go. But please remember this. This war started because I was too weak to stop it, but... I’ll always be your friend.

speaker: Eirika
text: Lyon...

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Eirika, what are you doing? It seems Queen Ismaire has been found. This way!

speaker: Eirika
text: Y-yes. Coming!

speaker: Innes
text: Queen Ismaire... Is she...

speaker: Seth
text: We’re too late. Her injuries are... She will not last much longer.

speaker: Ismaire
text: ...Jo...Joshua... ...Joshua...

speaker: Eirika
text: Queen Ismaire!

speaker: Ismaire
text: Oh, Joshua... Where is...that boy...

speaker: Eirika
text: Queen Ismaire...

speaker: Ismaire
text: Please forgive me, Joshua... I was a foolish mother... I was so intent on being queen that I spared no time to be your mother. But I loved you nonetheless... Please understand...

speaker: Joshua
text: ..... I know, Mother.

speaker: Eirika
text: Joshua...

speaker: Ismaire
text: Joshua... It really is you... Joshua...my son...

speaker: Joshua
text: I’m sorry, Mother. I should never have left you. I’ve no excuse... I wanted to see the world as a man, not as a prince. I wanted to be worthy. I planned on returning to your side afterward... I was so foolish. If I’d been here, I could have–

speaker: Ismaire
text: No, it’s fine. You’re here now... Listen to me, Joshua. The Stone of Jehanna has... been destroyed. The one who tempted Carlyle is responsible...

speaker: Joshua
text: What? Who was it?

speaker: Ismaire
text: ...Carried a dark stone... It is...the origin of all this... It should not exist... Joshua...you must... Our country...our people...

speaker: Joshua
text: I understand, Mother.

speaker: Ismaire
text: Thank you...Joshua... I have something... Something I must give you...

speaker: Joshua
text: This is...

speaker: Ismaire
text: It’s one of the Sacred Twin relics, unique to House Jehanna... He who would rule our land must possess it... I’ve watched over it since your father passed away. I kept it safe and waited for this day to come...

speaker: Joshua
text: Mother... I have it now. I understand its meaning...

speaker: Ismaire
text: Joshua... My...dear, sweet child...

speaker: Joshua
text: Mother...

speaker: Joshua
text: It’s been more than ten years. I’d grown tied of the formality of palace life, so I...just left. I wrote a farewell and left the palace, taking nothing with me. I felt I could never understand the people while I stayed sequestered in a castle. I abandoned my identity and roamed the continent, working where I could. I wanted only to be worthy of becoming king. I knew one day I would return. Gods, I was so foolish! I was such a child, I see it now. Was I simply rebelling against my mother? Punishing her for tending to her duties?

speaker: Joshua
text: I was a fool, yes, but I learned much over these ten years. I have learned about the hearts of our people, how they need to be governed. I have learned how our country needs to change and to grow. I have learned much, but I’ve lost much more. Mother...

speaker: Eirika
text: Prince Joshua...

speaker: Joshua
text: I made a promise. I want to continue what she began. I will help defeat Grado. I will defend Jehanna and her allies. ...I know it doesn’t sound like me, but...

speaker: Innes
text: On behalf of Frelia, I came to Jehanna with a letter to the throne. I give it to you. Prince Joshua of Jehanna... Let us fight together.

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Renais, Frelia, Rausten, and Jehanna. Four nations...united!

speaker: Eirika
text: Yes, I suppose that’s true. And my brother is with us as well. And if it were possible... Lyon... I wish you could be here with us, too.

speaker: Soldier
text: Fire! Fires have broken out all through the hall!

speaker: Joshua
text: What?

speaker: Soldier
text: The curtains were soaked in oil, with torches set about the hall. It’s a trap! Someone did this during all the fighting. You must flee! Quickly, before the flames engulf us all!

speaker: Seth
text: Princess Eirika. We must evacuate...

speaker: Eirika
text: I know. Joshua, we must go. Now.

speaker: Joshua
text: No... Mother... Forgive me...

speaker: Eirika
text: Is everyone well? Did anyone get left behind?

speaker: L’Arachel
text: We all made it. It’s so smoky that it’s hard to tell, but we’re here. What a cowardly act, setting fire to the palace hall. But we’ve escaped without injury. The enemy’s trap has failed.

speaker: Innes
text: ...No, it hasn’t. Assemble the troops now. The enemy is coming.

speaker: L’Arachel
text: What did you say?

speaker: Innes
text: This is the reason for the fire. To drive us from the palace. They’ll be attacking soon. No other plan makes sense.

speaker: L’Arachel
text: How is it that you know that?

speaker: Seth
text: Princess Eirika. I’ve just received word that Grado reinforcements are headed this way. There are two armies, led by Generals Valter and Caellach.

speaker: Eirika
text: No!

speaker: Innes
text: Two armies... They’re willing to send so many here and leave the capital defenseless?

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Why does everyone seem so distraught? It matters not who stands in our path. We shall smite them all with the power of righteousness!

speaker: Seth
text: Princess Eirika... It’s going to be very difficult for us to continue. One of Grado’s generals alone is more than a match for us. Compound that with the exhaustion of our troops, and I’m not sure we can–

speaker: Innes
text: Bah... With Jehanna Hall in flames, we’ve no place to hole up and dig in for a siege. We have to retreat. We have to win ourselves time for form a plan. Grado sent two generals... What could be happening in their capital? And what of Ephraim? Is he still alive?

speaker: Eirika
text: ...Brother...

speaker: Tirado
text: What a pleasant surprise. It’s Master Valter.

speaker: Valter
text: What’s the situation, Tirado? You have captured Ephraim, haven’t you?

speaker: Tirado
text: No. Prince Ephraim still fights in the lands north of Renvall.

speaker: Valter
text: And why is that? What has happened to all those mercenaries you hired?

speaker: Tirado
text: They’ve proven to be less then adequate. Ephraim’s clever. His band strikes quickly and then vanishes into the woods. We more than double his numbers, and yet he uses the terrain wisely to fight us. He has no army–just a small force of knights loyal to Renais. Prince Ephraim’s reputation as a superb strategist would seem to be well earned.

speaker: Valter
text: Hmm... How interesting. The lad’s beginning to whet my appetite. Tirado...Bring him to me as quickly as you can, will you?

speaker: Tirado
text: As you command. Just grant me an army, and I’ll bring him down swiftly.

speaker: Valter
text: What sort of plan do you have?

speaker: Tirado
text: Master, I am your loyal adjutant, and you are my general. For you, my lord, I have many plans ready and waiting.

speaker: Valter
text: Really? Well then, let me hear them.

speaker: Tirado
text: Very well. First, you and I will leave this fort and head north. Then, we will find Prince Ephraim in his leafy playpen.

speaker: Valter
text: But he’s not easily found, is he?

speaker: Tirado
text: Do not worry. At Prince Ephraim’s side is... a friend, shall we say. When the time is right, our friend will move on our behalf...

speaker: Ephraim
text: Forde, how are we on supplies and equipment?

speaker: Forde
text: It’s not looking good. Our weapons are in bad shape, and we’re running low on food. We can probably restock at a nearby village, but–

speaker: Ephraim
text: No, that’s not an option. We’re in enemy territory. I will not involve innocents if I can avoid it.

speaker: Forde
text: Yeah, I knew you’d say that. I mean, it’s because of stuff like that that we’ve stuck with you so far. But eventually, we do need to face reality. What are we going to do?

speaker: Kyle
text: Word of mouth has it that the invasion of Renais has progressed quite far. I’ve heard that the capital has fallen.

speaker: Ephraim
text: Hm...So soon... Still, my father is in the capital, and he won’t surrender easily. Forde, Kyle. Our mission here is to harry the troops, to distract their eye. Hopefully, we’ll be able to give my father and Eirika time to escape. Kyle, have you heard anything from Orson? I sent him ahead to scout.

speaker: Kyle
text: No word yet, and it’s about time he returned...

speaker: Orson
text: Reporting in, Prince Ephraim. I can confirm Grado presence at several points around our camp. Also, a large battalion of soldiers has been dispatched from Renvall. We shouldn’t tarry here any longer than necessary...

speaker: Ephraim
text: I see.

speaker: Forde
text: Seems as though we’ve certainly caught Grado’s eye this time. Should we retreat back to the capital, Prince Ephraim?

speaker: Ephraim
text: No. We press onward. We’re going to capture Renvall.

speaker: Forde
text: Wh-what?!?

speaker: Ephraim
text: So this is Renvall, is it? All right, let’s go.

speaker: Forde
text: Um...Are you...sure you’re quite sane, Prince Ephraim? We’ve an entire army after us, and you want to charge their stronghold?

speaker: Kyle
text: Forde! Watch your tongue! This is our prince you’re addressing!

speaker: Ephraim
text: Kyle, please, it’s all right. We’ve heard nothing from home, So what harm could a little reckless besieging cause?

speaker: Kyle
text: Prince Ephraim...

speaker: Ephraim
text: Don’t worry. I haven’t lost all sense of self-preservation. Renvall holds an important place in Grado’s national defense. If we can get the upper hand and take control of it, then Grado will waste many valuable soldiers trying to take it back I hope our attack proves useful to my father and Eirika.

speaker: Forde
text: I understand what you’re saying, but... can we do it with our current strength?

speaker: Ephraim
text: Every soldier in this area is trying to find us. The enemy has us vastly outnumbered. Attacking the castle is a ridiculous idea. If the enemy thinks the same... then we may have our opening.

speaker: Forde
text: You have a point. I’m sure Renvall won’t expect us to attack with these numbers. Either way, we can’t run forever. And we’re running out of supplies. What’ve we got to lose? Shall we get ready to go?

speaker: Ephraim
text: Yes. If we don’t move quickly, we may never get another chance. Trust me. I don’t pick fights I cannot win.

speaker: Kyle
text: Yes, sir!

speaker: Zonta
text: An attack? By Ephraim’s troops? To arms! Prince Ephraim’s circled around and brought the fight to us! If we capture the prince here, we can line our pockets with gold! Do you understand? We’ll be rich!

speaker: Ephraim
text: Orson.

speaker: Orson
text: Yes...

speaker: Ephraim
text: Your wounds still haven’t healed from that last battle, have they? Don’t push yourself. If we’re defeated, you must return to Frelia. Understood?

speaker: Orson
text: Understood...

speaker: Ephraim
text: Let’s go! Kyle! Forde!

speaker: Zonta
text: Do you truly think you can take us with those numbers? Imbecile! You’ll learn the error of your ways.

speaker: Zonta
text: L-lord Tirado...It can’t be... Were we...merely pawns?

speaker: Kyle
text: We’ve secured the entire castle. You were brilliant, Prince Ephraim! What a plan! What a battle!

speaker: Ephraim
text: I estimate at least half of the enemy troops are in the field. We took the castle, but we don’t have the manpower to hold it in a siege. There’s no point in lingering here. Let’s continue on to Grado Keep.

speaker: Forde
text: Prince Ephraim, things have taken a turn for the worse. I took a look around the castle perimeter... We’re surrounded.

speaker: Kyle
text: What?

speaker: Ephraim
text: Grado’s sent reinforcements? So quickly...?

speaker: Kyle
text: What should we do?

speaker: Ephraim
text: ...... We must escape!

speaker: Valter
text: So, you’ve captured Renvall, have you? And with such a small force! Impressive! You’ve earned your reputation. I must say, I quite admire your work. I take it you’re the leader of this pack–the misguided Prince Ephraim.

speaker: Ephraim
text: I am.

speaker: Valter
